Отличная игра старых времен, очень трудная даже! Ну и цитата Томми в конце игры: Знаете, этот мир не управляется законами, написанными на бумаге. Он управляется людьми. Одними в соответствии с законом, другими — нет. От каждого человека зависит, каким будет его мир, каким он его сделает. А еще вам нужна уйма везения, чтобы кто-нибудь другой не превратил вашу жизнь в ад. И все не так просто, как нас учили в начальной школе. Но все-же хорошо иметь твердые убеждения и придерживаться их. В браке, преступлении, войне. Везде и всегда. Я все запорол. Так же, как Поли и Сэм. Мы хотели жить лучше, но в конце концов попали гораздо хуже, чем остальные. Знаете, я думаю, что во всем надо знать меру. Да, меру, вот хорошее слово. Тот, кто хочет слишком много, рискует потерять абсолютно все. Правда, кто слишком мало хочет от жизни, может вообще ничего не получить...

Estava aqui no Steam quando eu vejo um post simples, mas que chamou a minha atenção: Fiquei curioso. O comentário era sobre Squishy the Suicidal Pig. Ao visitar a página da loja acabei vendo que era um jogo indie nos moldes 8 bits ou seja, desafiador, simples e casual. Vamos tentar então. Quer saber minha experiência? Vamos abaixo... Então temos aí Squishy, o porquinho. Não tem como deixar de lembrar a bola da vez das crianças, Peppa Pig (Galinha pintadinha? Oi?), a porquinha feliz que quer a paz mundial. Bom, aqui não é bem assim que a coisa funciona e Squishy acabou seguindo por um caminho assim, menos ortodoxo. A história é sobre Squishy, primo distante de Peppa que tem a sua família feliz seguindo uma vida feliz. Até aí tudo bem. De acordo com o game, diz a religião dos porquinhos que, quando um deles é levado por um humano, ele é um porco abençoado e vai para o céu, todo feliz. Todos acreditavam nisso e a vida seguia normalmente.  A coisa começa a complicar quando os pais de Squishy são pegos pelo tal humano. Como o suíno amava muito seus pais ele não conseguiu suportar a solidão por muito tempo e resolveu colocar um fim na própria existência terrena. O que ele não sabia é que suicidas vão para o inferno e não para o céu. O que o faz acordar no inferno dos porcos onde o próprio demônio porco está lá para recepcioná-lo. Aparentemente com um gosto particular pelos suicidas. Mas para a sorte do porquinho, o chefe do subsolo está de bom humor e já que isso é raro, vai lhe dar uma oportunidade de ver seus pais e ser salvo. Para isso, ele deve cometer suicídio mais 30 (isso mesmo) trinta vezes. Dessa forma, depois do demônio ver esse teatro sádico e provavelmente rolar de rir com isso, irá libertar a alma de Squishy e finalmente enviá-lo para o céu. Err... #SQN Squishy não possui uma gama muito grande de movimentos. O porquinho anda para os lados e pula, nada mais. Em situações extremamente raras pode soltar uma bola de fogo (somente uma fase). Com isso para avançar você vai precisar de toda a ajuda do ambiente para fazer o que nos outros games é uma das coisas mais simples. Morrer. O cenário é no estilo 8 bits, mas convidativo. O som cai muito bem com as fases tipicamente americanas. Velho oeste, Neve, Espaço sideral e bosque. Seu objetivo é procurar uma forma de matar o seu personagem. Muitas fases possuem somente uma maneira de se realizar o processo, outras possuem mais. Mas o objetivo continua o mesmo. As opções são, se jogar em buracos, lanças, estacas e deixar caixas caírem em sua cabeça.  Conforme o jogo avança, as opções de suicídio vão ficando cada vez mais complicadas e elaboradas. E aí o jogo começa a mostrar o seu potencial. Para avançar, você vai precisar de precisão nos pulos, timing nas bombas com contagem regressiva, posicionar objetos no logar exato, flutuar nos ventiladores, empurrar caixas no momento exato, evitar colocar itens nos lugares errados e, às vezes fazer tudo isso ao mesmo tempo na mesma fase. Você se sentirá frustrado, muito frustrado por não conseguir ou ao perceber o que deve ser feito para concluir uma fase. Várias vezes você deve seguir uma sequencia de eventos onde bem no final o risco de errar será enorme e você terá que recomeçar. O jogo sabe disso e lhe presenteia com um botão de  , sem precisar ficar entrando em menus de pausa, o que seria ainda mais frustrante e cansativo. Além da campanha principal, o game também lhe disponibiliza algumas opções extras como Versus, onde um porquinho deve matar o outro. Survival, onde caixas caem do céu e você deve desviar delas, sem chance de erro. Time attack, como o próprio nome diz, terminar o jogo no menor tempo possível e o "impossible level" uma fase 'impossível' onde o objetivo é sobreviver. Se já é difícil depender do cenário, da sua criatividade e de um botão de pulo para suicidar Squishy, o grande problema aparece mesmo quando você não deve morrer. O jogo possui   para erros, ou seja, qualquer toque incorreto nas várias armadilhas que a fase apresenta é necessário recomeçar. Sim, os desenvolvedores encheram as fases em que você deve sobreviver de perigos, buracos, ventos que desafiam a gravidade, estacas e lanças bem onde você deve subir os descer, bolas de ferro infinitas e muitos outros perigos. Alguns estágios (raros) possuem 1 único checkpoint que pode ser utilizado uma única vez. Existem fases onde o objetivo não é morrer e sim ir atras de chaves. Essas chaves abrem portas que irão te levar ao nível seguinte, mas alcançá-las é um trabalho extremamente calculista e preciso. Sua paciência será testada ao limite pois pequenos pixels são a diferênça entre a vida e a morte (indesejada dessa vez) Como se as fases de sobrevivência não bastassem, o game possui 4 chefes que devem ser derrotados com 3 níveis de dificuldade. Então, além da tolerância zero você deve derrotar inimigos com sede de sangue (ou bacon), sendo um trabalho de extrema paciência atingir conquistas que precisam derrotar os chefes em níveis mais difíceis. Não é para menos que uma delas de chama  Squishy the Suicidal Pig é um jogo muito bacana que parece que foi feito em 2 dias, mas não foi. As fases são super elaboradas e embora simples, possuem um toque de carinho. A trilha sonora encaixa bem no clima dos mapas e os modos Survival e time Attack adicionam um pequeno fator replay. Se tem paixão pelo seu controle, sua família e as outras pessoas que moram na sua casa e não são obrigados a te ver no estado máximo da fúria, fuja do [b "Impossible Level"[/b] e dos bosses no nível "insano". Recomendado se você tem sangue frio. Não recomendado se você perde a paciência com facilidade.

评价基于游玩了两个半小时EA版本的进度。纯通关的话大概一小时不到就能初见通。    这次是琪露诺遇到了扭曲空间的异变，然后去解决的故事。    EA版本只玩了传统闯关模式。目前就妖怪山、红魔馆、永远亭、旧地狱、白玉楼五个地图。每个地图一层是多个房间组成的正常模式，二层只有一个boss战房间，各自对应boss分别是河童、爱丽丝、橙、勇仪、幽幽子。总的来说从上一作的线性流程变成了地下城房间探索的肉鸽游戏了，耐玩性略有提高。 自机有琪露诺、魂魄妖梦、东风谷早苗、冴月麟等四个。目前两个多小时就解锁了琪露诺和冴月麟。一个偏远程一个偏近战。其余解锁要代币目前没刷全。    游戏主要两个，一个是人物升级的点数带来的天赋树系统，可以根据需要在各个方面加点，血量、蓝量、回蓝、移速、耐力、攻击、闪避等等等等。 一个是装备系统，装备可以打怪掉或者买装备，可以强化重铸，加成的属性也各不相同，能穿六个。目前装备自带的被动能力有很多还没实装。 宣传信息中说的每个房间的解谜系统和偶遇的野外商店好像暂时没看到。    人物可以做的说移动、普攻、DASH、技能符卡。 普攻无消耗，攻击和攻速堆上来后很不错。 主要是用蓝条的三选一符卡系统和用耐力的DASH系统， 因为打怪会掉落蓝，所以蓝完全不缺，后期点了回蓝后蓝量也玩得起。符卡可以很随意使用。 而耐力回复的很快，所以整体对于熟练度要求不高，也不用精密计算。    场景和人物采用像素风，整体感觉良好，人物立绘是也不错。不过写真模式还没实装。 BGM。说一句好听就完事了。    目前来说，无论天赋树的存在还是装备的存在，对于目前传统的闯关模式来说都数值爆炸，难度降低太多最后无双割草了。肉鸽模式刷刷刷系统的潜力很大，就是不知道后续开发能不能接上了。 如果说EA起步阶段的话，本作比起一代进步很大。玩过一代的我感觉可以值得期待。

50 Minute Presentation review: This  game is an apology to the original AOE III - because it had historical inaccuracies. I loved the original, but I love this one EVEN MORE :) because it's really crisp, for 2020.  Strategy has been re-lit , like an Olympic torch. AOE IV< is probably going to be gob-smacking. While each definitive edition tries to improve on the old, also by including all DLC's in the packages, sometimes the redefining of the old engine can only go so far, but it just continues to get better. Strategy in 2005 was either this, Warcraft 3, or Lord of the Rings Battle for Middle Earth, with 2 and DLC, following in the next 2 years. It was great, and then MOBA's took the lead. Anyway, this has city-deck building, RTS, tonnes of cinematics, historical accuracy, and precision, with LOTS< and lots of funny auto-dialogues, when you click around, Looks gorgeous - SSA by default - GTX 1070 regarded as 'very good'  CPU - i5 10400 - regarded as medium - lol  Streamed it while playing. Flawless. Strategy is highly required in mapping your armies, if you assign ONE slow unit to your legion, your entire army will die in slow motion - path finding - NOT AN ERROR _ You must not mix artillery, and foot soldiers, or melee heroes with cavalry. You will definitely need to be using the CTRL + 1 , 2, 3 , 4, Etc. Mappings to get your people in check. This can negatively impact your multiplayer gaming, the single player, skirmishes, etc. Firstly, this game is jam-packed with content. Historical content. Love. Lots and lots of incredible love.  We start off as pirates needing to fight middle-easterns with bow and arrows, vs. their rifles. Feels very reminiscent of BF1, except, we're stuck in the past.  Your strategy will require economic management, resource gathering, at a constant Pace. Shift + giving new commands in a row, or holding it to deploy buildings is where this game excels. Another cool feature was letting any other civilian join the build queue you create for one, as it's visible on the terrain. You can zoom in incredibly close. The image that stuck with me in the beginning was the cannon balls from my Ottoman bombardier rolling down the terrain after it based a collection of soldiers. The accuracy of animations of the cannonball interacting with the buildings. It's the work of a  team of perfectionists, and they were successful. The battles you create are better than both games before because creating units - _ Shift Clicking the unit to create = 5x per click. They work well as the unit deployed, and it's fun to manage the military resources too. I'm still in the beginning of the game, but each action you follow in the game- if you destroy all enemy forces on the map, you gain the most EXP - to assist with your city deck-building and upgrading and there are usually always extra missions per map/scenario. It's a definitive improvement on the first, 3rd AOE, lol. New PC requirements -A Good CPU< and some DDR4 RAM will go a long way to render this with many capable DX11 GPU's. [GTX650 + and up - probably best to start at 750's though, as nvidia stopped supporting 600's in their updates] My 50 min gameplay:

Awesome DLC to DLC - requires WotC. It adds 4 series of 7 missions that explore Central and Shen history between XCOM1 and 2. Allows you to play daily challenge missions to test your skill and luck vs others on the leadersboards. Completing the missions gives gear to the campaign - the most notable are the unique weapons for each tier. They come with mods equiped that cannot be changed but level up with each tier and those weapons are a great help at the start to mid levels untill you get some superior mods yourself.

CS:GO came up with is a great opportunity to play a decent   match. However, if you're in a bad mood and you're not premade with friends, it's not really worth playing. Your team will most likely consist of: -Offensive guys from nameless countries -Somebody who doesn't care about game result -A kid shouting in voicechat You would think, the higher rank, the more 'normal' players are, but unfortunately you'll find those on the whole rank scale. Don't even think about applying your tactics, opinions, the only answer you'll get is: ' ', or they'll straight go their own way. In case they would listen to you and your plan fails, get ready for a lot of swearing and disbelief at your address. If you try to argue with them, you'll possibly get votekicked. This can be for new players who found interest in Counter-Strike really annoying and confusing. Since they have nobody to play with, the solo queue is their only option. They can't really play DM and community servers forever, sooner or later they're going to play some real active match. The only way to find new friends to play with is to add them directly in-game. Well, finding serious teammates is tough. Seriously, CS:GO has thanks to MM such a great potential, but faults like these make talented players switch to Faceit/ESEA matches. Valve should focus more on this and the anticheat instead of useless stuff like sound of a slicing knife. Quality of this game would greatly increase and bring way more new fans. Thanks for reading,

As long as you do what you think is right, you can't go too wrong. Наверное, нет такого геймера, который бы не слышал об одном из лучших произведений Quantic Dream, а именно Фаренгейте. Игра, вышедшая в далëком 2005, по сей день может посоревноваться с современными проектами. Так что же заставляет бывалых игроков и тех, кто начитавшись обзоров, впервые запускает игру, погружаться в этот мир и проживать мистичечкую историю Лукаса Кейна? Конечно же сюжет. Усыпанные снегом улицы Нью-Йорка так и манят разгадать все свои тайны. Эта история в духе лучших детективов. Она поглощает, интригует и заставляет искренне сопереживать героям.  Стоит отметить одну особенность игры. Зима, которая кажется бесконечной, морозы и метели - всë это не отпугивает, а напротив создаëт особую атмосферу. Кажется, будто в этом холодном воздухе витает некий дух прекрасной меланхолии. А красивые саундтреки, как и мысли персонажей хорошо дополняют весь этот хрупкий мир.  Холодный мир, тëплые сердца. На самом деле игра не такая ледяная, какой кажется на первый взгляд. Несмотря на слегка депрессивный сюжет, тебе не дадут опустить руки и сдаться. Встречи с любимыми, тëплые диалоги, возможность заботиться об окружающих - это то, что делает нас людьми. И все эти маленькие моменты идеально балансируют с основным сюжетом.  Увы, но не без минусов. Пожалуй, самый главный из них - это управление персонажами. Если у тебя нет геймпада, готовься ломать клавиатуру. Довольно затянутые сцены с банальным тыканьем на нужные клавиши порядком поднадоедают, портя впечатление об игре. Со временем таких моментов становится всë больше, а кнопка рестарта нажимается всë чаще. И ты буквально хочешь кричать в монитор, что уже желаешь поскорее идти дальше по сюжету, а не избивать бедные wasd на очередной такой сцене. Но стоит учесть то, что игра довольно старая и многим олдскульным проектам, в отличие от современных, более дружелюбных по отношению к игрокам свойственна такая хардкорность. Поэтому все недочëты и трудности уходят на второй план.  Второй минус в том, что детектив ближе к финалу превращается в боевик. Весь этот экшен ну никак не увязывается с довольно размеренным началом.  Несмотря на все минусы, я могу порекомендовать Фаренгейта всем любителям интерактивного кино. Не обижайтесь на неë за недочëты, ведь она по сути является прародительницей жанра и одним из первых проектов студии.  Оценка - 9/10.

对于本作总体感觉就是中规中矩，但作为古墓重启三部曲的最后一部，可以算得上是一部合格的收官之作了。 在语言方面对国内玩家还是很友好的，从10代开始就有了中文配音，听起来很轻松很舒服，没有那种简单机翻的敷衍。 从9代的发布到暗影中间差不多间隔了五年半的时间画面剧情方面进步是可以看见的，但在玩法创新上面并没有多大的改变。 个人感觉这一部战斗、古墓探险、剧情方面都是不如崛起的，崛起是重启三部曲的巅峰。 最大的优点就是画面方面是比较惊艳的，无限接近于现实。顶尖的画面、顶尖的美工，但是在镜头的运转方面还是会有些生硬的感觉。剧情中对劳拉小时候的剧情描写可以说是本作最大的一个亮点。暗影给我的感觉就是有点啃老本的意思，战斗系统比前作是落后了，技能大多都没什么用。战斗的场面太少了 相比前两部来说战斗场面就太少了，这一部干掉的敌人相比之前来说就很少了。解密方面也是中规中矩，建议不要开提示玩，纯靠自己去想，有些难度下劳拉给提示后解密就显得很简单了。 古墓丽影在游戏方面绝对是佼佼者，这样的一个顶级IP绝对也是赤手可热的。希望SE在续作里面能对玩法进行一些创新，也是很期待续作的发布。

This is one of the best games I have ever played. A beautiful, awesome. lonely and terrifying game, built entirely on how you FEEL playing it, woven together by how you THINK through the history and atmosphere you discover. However: This game suffers SEVERE bugs. The gameplay is perfectly smooth, the controls work and the sounds and sights are all consistent, but very often when I reset my loop (including via early death), or very occasionally when i Translate a Text or use the Scout Launcher to recall of take a photo, the game crashes completely and closes. Of all the times I have stopped playing this game, I have chosen to do so, maybe 3 times. The other 50-80 times the game just closed itself. I still recommend this game COMPLETELY. Just be prepared to be annoyed at it.

Deponia Doomsday ist wirklich ein gelungener Abschluss der Deponia Reihe!  Wer die alten Teile liebt darf &' sollte sich diesen auf keinen Fall entgehen lassen. Deponia war immer schon bekannt für verrückte Ereignisse, aber dieser neue Teil topt alles! Zeitreisen, Zeitportale bei dem man, mit dem Betreten &'/oder Verändern eine neue Zeitschleife entstehen lässt in der alles komplett anders verläuft als in der Wirklichkeit. "Wirklichkeit" ist weit hergeholt. Im Spiel bringen wir gleich auf den ersten Metern so einiges aus der Reihe, womit das Abenteuer beginnen kann.  Zusammen mit einigen neuen aber auch vielen alten Charakteren erleben wir ein neues Abenteuer &' erfahren einige Dinge von denen wir nicht's wussten, da sie in einer anderen Zeitschleife passiert sind. Am Anfang mag es noch recht verwirrend sein, da man noch nicht in der ganzen Geschichte drin' ist. Das lichtet sich aber schnell im Laufe des Spiel's.  Mit fortschreitender Geschichte lüftet sich das ein oder andere Geheimnis. Man erfährt wie Dinge geschehen sind, obwohl sie im Spiel ganz anders dargestellt wurden (liegt eventuell daran das wir vorerst in den Zeitschleifen feststecken). Rufus sieht es anfangs noch als Spaß mit der Zeit zu spielen &' möchte sein Ende aus dem Dritten Teil umschreiben. Im Laufe des Spiel's wird ihm jedoch klar was er damit angestellt hat. Er hat in die Wirklichkeit eingegriffen &' somit eine komplett andere Welt erschaffen. Nun müssen wir alles wieder gerade biegen &' erleben somit eine schier endlose Reise durch die verschiedenen exestierenden Welten in den erschaffenen Zeitschleifen.  Deponia Doomsday ist, ich sage es gerne nochmal, der gelungene Abschluss der Reihe. Die neuen Charaktere lassen erahnen das ein neues Abenteuer wartet &' durch die alten Charaktere fühlt man sich heimisch. Es gibt natürlich auch wieder jede Menge schnippische Kommentare, detaillierte Dialoge mit alten Freunden, wunderschön gestaltete Minispiele &' eine Menge von Rufus' Manövern. Es ist eine klare Kaufempfehlung für die jenigen, die das Ende von Teil 3 so nicht stehen lassen wollen. Man erlebt teilweise die vergangenen Teile nocheinmal &' das macht das Spiel denke ich auch aus.  Als Abschluss alles nochmal revue passieren lassen. Es wird aber auch nochmal erklärt wieso man es hat so enden lassen. Letztentlich ist ja doch alles so geschehen wie es gesehen sollte, dass müssen Rufus, Goal &' wir akzeptieren, denn ändern kann man es ja schließlich doch nicht.  Viel Spaß! (:

I like this game but then again I'm a huge fan of the original games. In any regard I can have some fun with this game as it has much in common with the original.. In any case more the better, I think. It's really amazing that they'd release a game in this artistic style, specifically meaning the isometric and 2D way in which the game is portrayed in this day and age but more respect to them. I like it as it makes the game look beautiful. Some aspects of the previous games have been removed, various things like the (direct or 'classic') RPG element of the previous games (which are found in other ways though the game), there's no RMB move, flashlights are automatic and there's no ammo management. Elements I liked very much from the original. On a rather personal note though, I feel like guys should stop burning this game a new hole and just appreciate it for what it is. It's really good I think. It doesn't matter it's rehashed it's about the soul of the game. With this release that's been given a new breath and that's what matters.

NaissanceE è l’opera prima dello sviluppatore indipendente Limasse Five; la creazione dell’intero gioco è stata responsabilità di Mavros Sedeño che da solo si è occupato del game design, level design, sound design, art, cinematic design e finanche del marketing… unico apporto esterno allo sviluppo del titolo è stata la collaborazione con i compositori Pauline Oliveros, Patricia Dallio e Thierry Zaboitzeff per la colonna sonora del gioco. Per ammissione stessa di Mavros Sedeño, NaissanceE è un prodotto che è stato concepito e sviluppato con l’intenzione di avvicinarsi il più possibile all’estetica e alle atmosfere delle opere del noto fumettista giapponese Tsutomu Nihei. Molti sviluppatori nel tempo si sono cimentati nell’impresa di realizzare un qualcosa di aderente all’immaginario di Nihei, ma l’entusiasmo di questi pochi coraggiosi si è sempre puntualmente spento dopo il primo reale impatto con le ambientazioni impossibili concepite dall’ architetto nipponico… purtroppo l’abbandono e il fallimento sono due costanti ben note a qualsiasi creativo che si sia rapportato almeno una volta con l’universo di Nihei. Ad ogni modo voglio cogliere l’occasione per commemorare alcuni di questi coraggiosi “tentativi” falliti ma sicuramente degni di nota: “Blame! inspired walking simulator 2014” di bac9, “Megastructure” di Aloft Studios, “Hiversaires” di Rekka & Devine. Dove altri hanno fallito e gettato la spugna, lo sviluppatore Limasse Five è invece andato avanti riuscendo addirittura a traghettare il proprio prodotto sano e salvo fino alla release commerciale sulla piattaforma di distribuzione Valve. Per quanto mi riguarda il fatto stesso che NaissanceE sia riuscito a non essere abbandonato in fase di sviluppo e che l’autore sia “sopravvissuto” all’incontro con i design frutto della mente di Nihei è già evento di assoluto rilievo… però la domanda nasce spontanea: in cosa si è concretizzato questo incontro? O meglio, le intenzioni originali dello sviluppatore si sono realmente realizzate? Dopo aver trascorso circa sei ore per i sette livelli del gioco posso dire che Mavros Sedeño è sicuramente riuscito ad “andarci molto vicino” nonostante qualche compromesso. E’ cosa nota che quando si tratta di rapportarsi con la realtà del “fare” e specialmente con lo sviluppo del prodotto videogame il compromesso è spesso un qualcosa di propedeutico alla riuscita del proprio progetto… e NaissanceE non fa eccezione. In particolare il compromesso nel titolo si manifesta con l’assenza di qualsivoglia NPC / Mob, con la possibilità di interazione con l’ambiente circostante limitata solo a eventi puntuali (sezioni platform e risoluzione di puzzles) e con una narrazione del tutto latitante. Quello in cui il titolo invece brilla particolarmente sono le ambientazioni e le atmosfere che prendono forma all’ interno dei livelli di gioco: in NaissanceE siamo pellegrini in una metropoli sconosciuta, fin dove l’occhio arriva si vede solo un paesaggio artificiale. Il cielo e la luce del sole sono dimenticati, la natura organica è inesistente. Ci muoviamo in un dedalo di stanze, corridoi e scale; e quando finalmente si riesce a trovare un’uscita verso l’esterno ecco che si viene precipitati di nuovo in una realtà artefatta confinata da mura ciclopiche sulle quali si arrampicano strutture in bilico su strapiombi impossibili. In questi ambienti il giocatore è letteralmente perso, il level design suggerisce di rado il percorso per uscire dal labirinto che è la megastruttura tutto intorno a noi: trovare la strada giusta è un vero e proprio processo di trial and error. Alle volte durante l’esplorazione degli ambienti pare di essere finiti in un’opera di Escher, la dimensione del sopra e del sotto si perde; spesso dopo tanto camminare ci si ritrova davanti a dei vicoli ciechi, o intrappolati in percorsi che si rivelano poi dei veri e propri loop infiniti. Il silenzio della città ci parla: non siamo benvenuti in questi luoghi, l’ambiente che si sta attraversando non è stato costruito a misura di giocatore. La curiosa quanto onnipresente meccanica di corsa e respirazione unitamente alle musiche e ai rumori ambientali non aiutano a metterci a nostro agio: spesso ci assale un senso di angoscia, di vera e propria urgenza di evadere da questo luogo dove poco o niente si rapporta alla dimensione umana. La meraviglia che ci accompagna nei primi minuti di gioco degenera rapidamente in un senso di alienazione ed estraneità: questo è NaissanceE… questo è Nihei. In definitiva mi sento di dire che NaissanceE è un titolo notevole, e che siamo davanti ad un vero e proprio unicum… ma come tutte le singolarità anche NaissanceE non potrà mai incontrare il favore del grande pubblico. Per apprezzare appieno tutte le sfumature di questo titolo bisogna essere dotati di una certa sensibilità ed aver uno specifico background di conoscenze ed esperienze. Consiglio questo grande esperimento riuscito solo a quelle utenze Steam non completamente a digiuno dei temi e dei nomi citati in queste poche righe… per tutti gli altri prescrivo l’astensione: siete stati avvisati.                                                                                                                                                                                                                           Sotto alcuni mosaici originali composti con gli ambienti di NaissanceE:
ZHEN DE HAO WAN

Para você que está a procura de um jogo 3D de Blocos você o encontrou. Portanto este jogo tem os mesmos gráficos do jogo Minecraft contando que ele é de FPS. Vários modos jogáveis, e mais divertido se for com os amigos. O jogo é igual Ace Of Spades, você pode construir uma base, escolher classes, armas. É neste ponto que chegamos. Acontece que o jogo é Pay2Win. Onde você só consegue as melhores armas se comprá-las ou então passar semanas da sua vida tentando desbloquear elas. Se não gosta de jogos PAY2WIN ou quadriculados, eu não o recomendo este jogo. Mas para você que não se importa com os gráficos (Como eu) , bom o jogo é bastante divertido.

這個遊戲真的很棒！我喜歡游戲主題，精美的圖形以及幾乎所有遊戲。 從孩子開始，逐漸從小學，高中和高中學習。我認為該遊戲受到現實生活的強烈影響。我和我的家人都喜歡恐怖主題，這是一枚完整的炸彈。您在遊戲中獲得積分，但我認為這是最有價值的。我們應該考慮到當前正在玩遊戲，這可能與30年前對中國家庭的態度不同。當林說家庭不完整時，它突然改變了。這確實是一個很棒的遊戲。 該遊戲非常有趣，部分涉及現代家庭生活。遊戲的整體內容很棒。您可以在此遊戲上花費數十個小時。牛排約9美元。這對我來說是一個很好的價格，但價格可能很高，遊戲為我提供了許多功能！另外，我真的很喜歡這款遊戲的風格，當一家人完成時，它會很棒。同時，此遊戲是由我認識的人製作的，所以我知道如何製作遊戲。但是正如我在上一篇文章中所說，這款遊戲對我來說太便宜了，應該會更貴！ 我們建議您購買此遊戲！等級是10/10

Viewing Los Santos and its crazed action from the first-person perspective makes this experience feel new again The game looked stunning on Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3, but is even more of a sight to behold on the new-gen machines thanks to the increased resolution, draw distance, and a multitude of touches to the lighting and world The same great voice acting for Trevor and company. This is without a doubt the best Dragon Quest game to date. Epic story, memorable characters and incredibly beautiful visuals will amaze you in every way, there's something of everything for everyone in here and it's been a while since I had so much fun in a game, the hours just seem to fly and I was very sorry when my adventure came to a end. The story is by no means anything new, a child of light must defeat the forces of darkness and save the world, a common recurring theme in many stories yet this simple tale of love and hope will take you through a grand journey of campfire bonding, time travel, puff-puffs and the unique army of smiles, honestly you'll be in constant awe and laughter and long after the story has ended it will stick with you. The characters are equally as charming with each contributing to the story at various points and will have you laughing at their antics and the accompanying personal stories will only endear you to them further. Usually with a game of this magnitude some of the characters tend to be forgotten but I didn't get that feeling here. The visuals and music are rich and atmospheric, which is good because you'll constantly be required to travel back and forth the same areas and having eye-candy is always a plus There's alot to do in here and I mean ALOT, from sidequests, fleshing out a recurring side story to just trying your luck in the casino or horse-racing, there's something to keep you entertained. Dragon quest has always been about maintaining the identity and charm of good ol fashion jrpgs and I'm really happy how the devs have kept the classical feel and nostalgia while making it modern and fresh This is clearly a work of love and to me worth the asking price, show your support and keep the dream alive. 10/10.

Znaczy za czity inaczej WALLHACK, AIMBOT, TRIGERBOTS i rózne typy czitów. Prime: CO to PRIME ? PLUSY+ +fajna grafika  +wszystko jest praktycznie realistyczne chodzi o rozrzut broni>3 +Dużo dostępnych broni.! +Dużo fajnych Mapek  MINUSY- -kiedyś jednak był CS płatny w tej chwili nie jest no i co się z tym wiążę ? że bardzo dużo cziterów. -czasami VALVE może dać VAC za nic za uczciwą grę wiec? to też jest mega słabe! >3 POLECAM JAK NAJBARDZIEJ GRĘ I ZACHĘCAM DO KUPIENIA PRIME NA START BO NAPRAWDĘ JEST DUŻO CZITERÓW!!!!

RE2 Remake is an ashtounding game that have made which seemed imposible: get the calssic RE feeling, and adapt it to a present gampeplay. Especially playing in the hardest difficulty, when every bullet counts, and less inventory space (but maybe enemies do dtoo much amage) Talking about the games areas, the Police Deparment is amazing and is full of puzzles to solve. It's deffinetly the best zone of the game. The sewers are an improvement over the original sewers, but I believe the Remaked Lab, is worse than the original lab. But it has some minor flaws, things that wouldn't mind at all if it was new RE game, but being a RE2 Remake we need to have in mind some traits the original game had, but this Remake don't. For example, there is almost no difference betwen the A & B routes of each characters. Also there is no interaction beetwen a character A route and the other one B route as happened on the original game.  In original RE2, both characters will often engage with each other or  talk over a radio from time to time,  plotting about how they're gonna escape the nightmare, about finding Sherry, etc. Even there were a couple of items you coulnd't pick on B route, if you had taken that item during the related A route or even some that you could only get during B route if you have done the right stuff during A route. Summarizing, interaction between the 2 main characters and between the routes, are far worse than the original game Nevertheles, It's a wonderull game, and I hope Capcom will use this game as a base for RE8 than to follow the base of REVII and definetly it's the GOTY of 2019 together with FF XIV: Shadowbringers

游戏的优点很多人都已经说了，我就不再赘述，我想说一些缺点，微小的缺点。当然，我还是要附上我很喜欢的一个小说主角说的话当开场白，也希望大家不要太认真。毕竟我已经认真了，再认真了就没必要了。 游戏背景时代架空在三国时期的武侠世界，人社立绘声优游戏操作可以说在国产游戏中都能说的算上乘，却无法像仙剑之类的武侠类游戏一样，随着游戏剧情的深入，却无法有对游戏更深入的沉浸感。 要我说，剧情散漫，核心缺失都不是让游戏无法顺利玩下去的原因，事实上要我说这是一款瑕难掩瑜的游戏，即使制作方用了心在很多地方，却唯独少了细节。 首先，游戏如果是发生在明朝时期前后也还好，但游戏介绍说的是捏他三国的设定，那时间真发生在三国前后，那这里所有的游戏人物怕都是从现代穿越过来的。细节的不严谨导致人物和世界观设定与游戏开发本身的时间设定有极大的违和感，正是这种处处不严谨的细节让玩家或者说是我在游戏过程中被不断的放大，时空割裂感让这款游戏没有真正的武侠感，带来的是更多的穿越感。 1.虽然游戏中饭店里的食物可以提高玩家的修为，并且驴肉火烧，过桥米线，肉夹馍等都是玩家耳熟能详的传统食物，但肉夹馍始于秦，驴肉火烧始于明，过桥米线更晚，晚清才有的产物。时间跨度极大的不同地域的传统食物出现在酒店里，这位老板娘相必才是真正的中华小当家。 2.游戏的服饰和发色也充满了违和感。一开始的女主的师弟阿元的白头发，酒店老板娘贝贝的绿头发，花中将的粉头发。很多游戏都是闻声识人，这游戏直接就是见发识人。十人十色的头发颜色和发型虽然让每个角色之间有更高的辨识度，但也变相提高了游戏的违和感，花中将这种半露下酥胸的服饰估计放在哪个朝代都是要被批判的。 （历史上染发虽有2000年的历史，但通过植物染发一般就记载的就是从白染到黑，不过抓着这点打是我太小心眼了） 3.女主的鞋子既不是朴实无华的草鞋，也不是征战沙场的长筒靴，而是一双现代高跟鞋。用过高跟鞋的女性都知道，高跟鞋虽然能体现出女性的体态美，却十分影响足部筋骨健康，甚至会造成一系列的脚部后遗症。而女主却从头到尾用这双高跟鞋上天入地，战斗冒险，怕是女金刚都受不了这样的疼痛。另外高跟鞋虽始于明朝，但女主穿的高跟鞋却是现代产物，实在是充满了违和感。 总结一下，炼金工房我没玩过不太知道是什么属性，但剧情主线的推进和人物养成的确是有女神异闻录的影子，而且总的来说，颇有武侠风的音乐搭配专业的人物配音使得这款游戏在抛开这些小毛病后在我心中的评价很高，真的也是一款不可多得的国产游戏，值得玩家入手。

Что такое террария?  - Это когда "Эта ночь будет ужасна..." сразу после убийства стены плоти. А ты успел прожать приманку...  - Это когда пираты изнасилуют тебя, твою сестру, дочь, батю, деда, друга, бомжа, дерьмодемона просто потому что могут.  - Это когда отойдя от компа на часочек и оставив игру включенной ты устроил себе фарм надгробий, ибо гоблины - мудаки. - Это когда в первую ночь тебя Гид защищает от мобов, а ты пытаешься не сдохнуть, ибо это Бладмун - Это когда за 70 часов ты прошел чуть меньше половины контента с другом в мультиплеере, ибо это Эксперт, детка.  - Это когда на постройку хайпового дома ты тратишь 4 карты, ибо материалы выбить трудно в хардмоде. А потом еще 8 часов вдвоем строите хату покруче и помоднее.  - Это когда "фак, клоуны! О, а теперь хату не ломают =)" - Это когда Прей сосет, ибо тут есть крутые мимики, которые тебя трахнут во все щели, ибо могут. А ты нет.  - Это когда на битву с боссом ты строишь 100500 ферм, дабы намутить зелий, огнемета, бабла, но все равно дохнешь от ссаных мобов, пришедших на тусу.  - ЭТО ВЕЧЕРИНКА ОЛЛ ДЕЙ!  - Это охуенное музло, которое не надоедает - Это более тысячи предметов. И хуй ты их скрафтишь на одной карте все.  - Это вера в то, что будут еще боссы после 1.3 - Это мобы, мобы, мобы, мобы....  - Это когда "ОПА ПОСОХ СЛИЗНЕЙ!(шанс охуенно низкий) Бля, но он же говно!" - Это когда в Дарксоулс ты и то меньше мансуешь от боссов Это 11 КТулху из 10

這是我第二次玩古墓奇兵的遊戲，這個遊戲實在是太棒了。就算沒有玩過前面的作品，也可以很快的跟著蘿拉進入探索世界，完全不會有適應不良的問題，而且戰鬥方面，做的還蠻容易上手的，不用擔心手殘而死很多次，只需要注意看動畫的時候手不能隨便放開搖桿，不然真的會被QTE害死。此外，劇情部分也做得相當用心，隨著探索的進行，一步一步抽絲剝繭，真的很有趣。尤其是最新的sesson pass雖然沒有戰鬥部分，但是劇情真的很扣人心懸。有興趣的話，真的值得入手。

"Tráenos a la chica y borraras tu deuda", el único objetivo que tiene que cumplir nuestro personaje que lo hará viajar hasta las nubes y lo montara en una aventura alucinante y única!! Sin duda uno de los mejores juegos de estos últimos años, con una buena trama,  una jugabilidad y controles impresionante (tanto con gamepad, como con teclado y mouse), mejorada de sus antecesores Bioshock y Bioshock 2. No hay mucho que pueda decir que no se haya dicho ya en otras reviews, así que destaco algunos de sus puntos mas fuertes. Pro: -Buena historia, muy buena trama, y giros inesperados. -Buenos controles y jugabilidad. -Gráficos y diseños impresionantes. -Muy buena optimización y fluidez. -Buena ambientación y sonido. -Armas y habilidades mejorables. -Lugares secretos. Contra: -Tiene uno que otro bug, como el mas conocido Salón de los Hérores, donde Elizabeth se queda colgando en el aerocarril y no se mueve. El juego en si es una obra maestra y no es necesario comprar los DLC para completar la historia, aunque si para desbloquear todos los logros. 10/10

Сколько же крутых эмоций подарили мне эта игра, особенно онлайн (играю с выхода онлайна на ps3). Очень жаль, что такой крутой и амбициозный проект скатился в донатный фикалис. Каждое новое обновление только ухудшает ситуацию. Может, конечно, этот "контент" кому-то и понравится, но уж точном не трушным фанатам серии жта. >Жта вышла на пк вместе с ограблениями, и чёрт, как же это было круто. Все с удовольствием играли в эту игру, бегали выполняли задания, старались, свободные сессии были наполнены игроками, которые не только фармили, но и наслаждались игрой. Именно тогда ощущалась атмосфера жта. >2015 год - выходят "Лоурайдеры". Всем все нравилось. Все проходили задания от Ламара, устраивали сходки лоурайдеров и просто кайфовали от игры. >В свет выходит обнова "Большие люди и другие бандиты", и в тот момент стало ясно, что ♥♥♥♥♥♥ ты легко заработаешь на всё это, но даже так всем всё снова нравилось. Это было первым звоночком к тому, что сейчас из себя представляет игра... >2016 год - Обновление "Новые приключения бандитов и мошенников". По началу все думали, что это крутая обнова, и это так. Появились офисы, возможность легко фармить деньги на ящиках, но по факту затрат всегда было больше, чем дохода с этого кала. Нужно было трать ДНИ на то, чтобы все это ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥о окупить. >Чуть позже выходят "Байкеры". Это было глотком свежего воздуха после всех этих "крутых" и дорогих суперкаров, домов и тд. Было много крутых задание мотоклуба, появились предприятия по производству всякого разного. Все продолжали наслаждаться игрой. Можно было двигаться дальше в этом направлении, но........ >13 декабря 2016 - дата смерти пациента, а именно выход обновы "Импорт/экспорт". Теперь всем стало ясно в каком направлении будет двигаться игра. Кто имеет бабки, тот у рулит в свободной сессии, т.к транспорт был ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ец каким дорогим и ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ец каким имбовым. Свободные сессии начали наполняться военной техникой, но это было пол беды. Самое ужасное, что могло произойти в игре - появление Opressor`а. Красивая картинка, сюжет, музыка, геймплей.   одни и те же враги надоедают Я стараюсь всегда следить за новинками видеоигр, особенно тех, которые обещают быть хитами. Об выходе Alan Wake на PC я узнал буквально за месяц до релиза. И звучал он примерно так - "разработчики обещали выпустить игру на PC". Ничего конкретного, и ничего точного. Даже даты релиза не было. Просто в начале 2012 года. Не смотря на это, у меня была надежда, что игра скоро выйдет на PC, не будут переносить по сто несколько раз. Даже к моменту покупки игры купил себе новую видеокарту. Поиграл в нее сразу же в день выхода это 16 февраля. Запустил долгожданную игру, сразу, что бросается в глаза, это уровень исполнения. Первый видеоролик, просто потрясающий, нам показывают бесподобные пейзажи и главного героя, с красивой музыкой на заднем плане. На Xbox'е не раз говорили, что графика мол устарела, но этого не заметил. Просто отличная проработка леса, необычная камера справа и анимация персонажа, которая заслуживает отдельной похвалы. Плюс все выполнено на таком уровне, что смотришь как будто фильм. Настоящий высокобюджетный фильм! Сюжет нам рассказывает историю одного писателя, который переживает творческий кризис, отправляется со своей девушкой за город, чтобы пережить этот момент. Далее девушка пропадает, и главный герой начинает её поиски. Чтобы избежать спойлеров, скажу, что история разворачивается самым необычным образом. Игра способна держать в напряжении буквально на всем протяжении, некоторые неожиданные моменты способны напугать. Нельзя сказать, что это хоррор, скорей триллер. Alan Wake способен завлечь не на один вечер, красивой картинкой и интересным сюжетом, для меня игра стала настоящим хитом.

Fable Anniversary enhances the original with better graphics and visuals. As a fan of the original Fable back in 2005, this version of the game still holds it's charm. If you have never played a Fable game before, there is no better game to start the series off with than by playing the first one. If you enjoy decision making elements in rpgs than this is your game. The story and music is excellent as well as has a good sense of humor. You will be solving riddles and completing side quests that build your characters alignment (good or evil). Fighting all sorts of humans and creatures on the way using mele, range, or magic. Depending on what paths to take is all up to you. Don't keep standing there like a lemon and buy this game already!

So, all in all, I have to say that “Sakura Gamer 2” is a really great visual novel. As for cons, the game has very few down sides. You know, now that I think about it. The only thing that really bothered me a bit, would be the fact that “Sakura Gamer” ends when the game is just about to hit the next level lewd awesomeness. Other than that though, I had a real blast with the game. In other words, if you enjoy lewd visual novels, then you’re going to love “Sakura Gamer” for sure! Pros: + Top quality lewd content + Top notch art, designs and visuals + Finally a game where the yuri moments doesn’t suck + Well-made characters, dialogs and dialog options + The music is rather catchy + A very interesting plot and a handful of plot twists + Different endings + The Sakura Gamer ladies are very cute and sexy Cons: – The game ends just when things start to heat up – Sakura Gamer might not be your cup of tea if you don’t like Yuri content (shame on you!) – Some players might find some parts of the game to be too slow (too much text, too little action)

Mon jeu préféré de cette année. (Je vais en dire que du bien vous êtes prévenu haha). C'est un mélange entre Metroid, Dark souls et Super Meat Boy. Le gameplay est aux petits oignons, précis, facile à prendre en main et jouissif, mais demandera une certaine dose de skill et de patience avant de le maitriser complètement.  Plus vous avancerez dans l'aventure plus vous débloquerez de nouvelles aptitudes qui enrichiront vos combats, mais aussi le level design. Car comme dans un Metroid il y a plein de passages qui nécessitent des pouvoirs particuliers pour pouvoir continuer à avancer dans le niveau. Le bestiaire doit être un de ceux qui se renouvelle le plus dans un jeu 2D, que ça soit les ennemies ou les boss vous ne tomberez jamais de lassitude jusqu’à la fin. L'exploration est toujours récompensée, il y a plein d'objets, d'upgrades cachées qui sert réellement au gameplay, donc on devient vite accro à farfouiller la map. La direction artistique et les graphismes devront vous tenir en haleine, bon ça ne vaut pas du Ori and the blind forest, mais quand même, il y a vraiment un cachet et une atmosphère particulière.  L'OST y contribue aussi grandement. Sinon en ce qui concerne les défauts... il n'y en a pas beaucoup à mes yeux (huhu) le truc qui m'a le plus chagriner c'est surtout la gestion de l'argent. Une fois qu'on a acheté tous les items des marchants au début-millieu de l'aventure et bien après elle ne sert plus à rien. On se retrouve avec une montagne de geos (la monnaie du jeu) connement j'usqu'à la fin.

Great character creation, fun and engaging gameplay, and a beautifully designed world with stunning environments just add to the deep role-playing experience that is the heart of the games. As of this review, it's in early access and there are a host of visual bugs and some gameplay glitches, but they are minor enough as is, and the Devs are fixing more each day. If you love D&D and role-playing games, this is for you. If you love strategic, turn-based, combat, this game is for you. If you love beautiful environments and rich, thought out characters, this is for you. If you enjoy the things mentioned above and have $60 and the Hard Drive space to spare, get this game.

I played this game some time after it's release at a friends house, i didn't enjoy it at all, don't know what it was but i was 11 at the time so i had different standards then. I recently bought it again just because i saw the different mods for the game so i decided to try it again. I started off vanilla. The game is amazing, i love it. I don't know what it is i just love it now and can say it's somewhere on my top 5 games list. And after modding it's even more fun to play. This is the first Elder Scrolls game i've completed and i feel proud about it. So far i've completed the Main, Dark Brotherhood, Thieves Guild and College of Winterhold quest lines. Highly recommend this game, i'd rate it a 9/10 because the main quest line could've been longer in my opinion.

Among Us: Великолепная игра перекочевавшая на ПК с мобильных устройств (где я собственно и начинал играть). Представляет из себя подобие настолки "Мафия", в которую многие когда-то активно играли, будь то у друзей, в каком-нибудь кафе, или у себя дома. Здесь все так же можно собраться друзьями в том же Discord'e (или по внутриигровому чату) и зависнуть в Among Us получая просто океанище положительных эмоций. Помимо всего прочего можно играть и с рандомными людьми (пусть это не так весело, но возможность есть, это круто). Так же есть подобие кроссплатформы, так что можете играть с ПК вместе с другом, который сидит с телефона. К слову на мобильных устройствах Among Us бесплатная. Так же хочется отметить, что при создании сессии на картах из DLC, с вами могут играть друзья, у которых не куплены эти карты. Мелочь, а приятно. И все это великолепие дополняется прекрасным сеттингом игры, геймплеем. По сути плюсы я перечислил, но теперь собственно к положительным особенностям игры... Плюсы: - Рисовка очень милая, цветастая и красивая, те же анимации смотрятся гармонично и приятно. Сами персонажи не менее милые, к ним же в придачу идет небольшая косметическая кастомизация с забавными деталями одежды. - Геймплей, в котором группе космонавтов нужно починить космический корабль или станцию посредством выполнения квестов с мини-играми, а так же вычислить маньяка, который притворяется союзником. В этот момент самому маньяку (которого рандомно выбирает игра из всех игроков) необходимо прикончить всех коллег. При этом маньяк помимо самого убийства может всячески мешать космонавтам в выполнении задачи саботажем, а так же облегчать себе задачу выключая свет или перекрывая двери на станции и корабле. - Гибкая настройка сессии, от скорости перемещения и дальности видимости, до сложности квестов и количества маньяков на команду. Можно создать реально суровые условия, при которых космонавтам нужно действовать слаженно и держаться вместе. Подводя итоги: Минусов у игры к моему удивлению нет. С тем же соединением нет никаких проблем. Так что по сути игра идеальна, за свою цену тем более (на мобильных устройствах бесплатная). Разработчикам огромное спасибо за такой небольшой проект, который дарит невообразимые эмоции и настроение. Оценка: 10 импосторов из 10

I heard of this project a couple of years ago, and it's finally out. Good job. I'm impressed in some ways that a small sized studio can pull off with these stunning VFX, particle effects, etc. Optimization wasn't the best, but it is understandable for such a small sized team to make something with certain degrees of visual fidelity on UE4. Now let's talk about possible improvements. 1. UI   UI, in general, is rather messy. Quality of the icons are not great, rather low quality I'd say; this applies to the text showing in-game as well. Pay attention to how the icons and texts scale on the different resolution would definitely help. More than that, I feel that some of my screen space has been taken by unnecessary halos, which does not really help with anything. Blurry text is another thing; I understand if the blur occurs situationally as your gadgets got interfered with EMP and such things but come on, my eyes are bleeding with those blurs. 2. Mechanics   You have good knowledge of video games because your design shows a lot of it. However, this is exactly where the problem is. You mixed a lot of elements from other games, and throw it to us. I don't see anything original, thus no points for creativity here. Some of the mechanics just don't work well together; more doesn't mean better. Trim down mechanics that are not well implemented is actually going to help with the experience. Enemy AI is rather simple, not really challenging at all. I feel that you could reduce the types of enemies, but spend more time on designing their logic would make the combat more enjoyable. It is quite repetitive at its current state. Level design wise I think some especially when you're traveling thru different areas has been done good, but when it comes to combat area, I feel little options to take advantage on the environment around me. 3. Visual Art  In order to make an immersive experience, you need a coherent art style. During the gameplay, I feel like I was traveling in different games. I saw elements from Uncharted, Tomb Raider, Quantum Break, Titanfall, Shadow Warrior and even more. The art style of a game needs to be consistent for us to feel immersive, which I believe is what you're trying to achieve. For example, the weapon you gave us, a 1911 like a pistol, Titanfall style assault rifle, and a shotgun that the design that doesn't make any sense. The verdict is that you need to do homework on art related stuff rather than just mashing up everything and throw them in there. 4. Sound   Track-wise is actually better than I expected. It gives you some of that DOOM style metal but not as heavy. However, it feels repetitive overtime and even become noisy. Sound effects and voice overs aren't really good; it's quite awkward in fact. One of the reasons I don't feel the combat is satisfying is when you kill an enemy, they don't make any satisfying noise, which is very underwhelming for a game relies almost solely on combat. Voice overs are just simply awkward. Actors' tone doesn't really much with what is going on in the game.  5. Design decisions   For one collectibles feels useless. When I found something, it basically just said I found blah blah blah and done. No rewards, no backgrounds, it feels more like a placeholder rather than an actual game mechanic. Secondly, with boost jumps, flash dodges being part of the mechanics, I believe you really want the movement to be fluid. But it does feel very clunky; it lacks transitional movements. Implement something like slide, would help.       Overall I really like what you're doing, very good job! But this is not a free game, and yet you make it like a tech demo or something you would put into your portfolio when you apply for jobs in a game company. Doesn't matter it is early access or not, it is a product for sale, so it should have a standard. Good luck in improving your game, big thumbs up!

Playing Evoland is like traveling through time. For all those people who started playing video games in the 1980's, it's a nostalic trip back to these good old days. But even if you got infected by gaming fever later in your life, you will enjoy this game. Starting in a black and white environment, the game itself envolves to a modern 3D game - all these while you are playing a nice RPG with some secrets to discover. Some hours of gameplay just makes you wish for more.

After completing it a second time I believe I can fully review this now. I'll start off by not mentioning the horror, But the story. Coming form Dead space 1 to this the stroy flows through really nicely. Its a great story and like number 1 you find a lot of backstory about whats happening throughout.  The horror. Well In the begining its fantastic. A few nicely put jump scare moments and some really scary mecromorhps get your heart going and you find yourself scouring and survivng the best you can. As a con however near the end the horror looses its edge as it become more action non stop style. But its the end and its expected. The anticipation for the end of the story covers it nicely however and you dont really miss the horror at the end. The comabt mechanics are spot on. All i can recommend is try using different weapons as much as possible. A lot of people say you will only use the pulse rifle and plasma cutter. But if you buy the other weapons you can have much more fun & they are more effective. Such as the javelin gun (A personal favorite). Overall Its a 9.5/10 for me. Highly Recommened.

(Metal gear)Survive so lautet das sequel zu MGS dabei eher die betonung auf survive als auf metal gear!^^ Status: Einzelspieler durch Spielzeit: hmmm ich weiß jetzt nicht genau weil ich auch öfters mal im koop war texten wir mal so 20-25 stunden. Bugs: Keine gesichtet! Pro -Sehr viel beute also schutz sachen für arme hosen handschuhe und körper ist alles dabei granaten, granaten pfeile(sehr gut!)fallen,gewehre, pistolen usw. -Verschieden farbige beute von standart bis legendär. -Anpassung waffen kleidungen kann man alles anpassen obs die farbe oder eine zusätzliche tasche für muni ist^^auch kann man seine legendären sachen zusatz effecte verpassen wie mehr stärke oder so. -Basis aufbau ziegenkäfige, tomatenplantagen, verschiedene werkbänke für waffen etc(die man auch noch verbessern kann)Abwehranlagen wie mörser selbstschuss maschinengewehre. -Klassen am anfang hat man nur die klasse überlebender was sich aber nach dem ersten durch spielen ändert dan kommen noch 4 klassen hinzu. -2 Gebiete, die man erkunden kann nicht gerade groß aber geht klar. -Sauerstoff ich bin mir nicht sicher ob man vielleicht noch eine andere flasche bekommen kann aber wurst.Find ich eigentlich okay man kann zudem noch die flasche wärend man im staub wandelt befüllen mit sauerstoff durch kuban energie deswegen geht das klar. -Anmelde bonus wo man auch manchmal SV-münzen kriegt(Die echtgeld währung) So ein mittel ding: man kann echtgeld ausgeben für einen 2 chara platz, der aber für mich nicht von belang ist!(aber anderen vielleicht wegen 2 zocker im haushalt)dan kann man sich noch premium machen ich weiß jetzt nicht wat dat kostet aufjedenfall kriegt man da dan immer jeden tag oder so ressourcen. Aber ich bin auch so ganz gut durch gekommen! Story war nicht schlecht aber auch nicht gut! Con -Man kriegt zu schnell hunger und durst(Der typ oder frau den man da spielt müsste ja schon fett wie sonst was sein so oft wie der gefüttert werden will und wird xD) (Das spiel ist ja kein wie wird man fett simulator^^) -Legendäre beute oder überhaupt die richtig guten sachen gibt es nur im koop zu ergattern! -Die Spielersuche ist grottig!, die sollten wegens eine globale suche rein machen weil ganz einfach zu wenige das spiel anscheinend gekauft haben! -Ist noch ein wenig eintönig durch die gleichen karten sich zu ballern ich hoffe da kommen noch mehr modi und karten hinzu! -Mehr nebenmissis für den einzelspieler! ist meisten nur öffne nen container oder wilde tiere. Fazit: Ein recht gutes spiel wenn man nicht an die erwartung herangeht das es ein MGS ist es ist halt survive!^^

Lucifer Within Us is a hard nut to crack when it comes to recommending it or not. It's a game that story based mystery players will want to play: it uses a gameplay system that can stand up to the likes of the Danganronpa's or the Phoenix Wright's of the world. It has an intriguing setting with a cool concept regarding demons influencing people to make them commit crimes. It builds to an interesting over arching plot about the influence of Lucifer and how his subtlely pulls strings to create the crimes and the scenarios. The game has the formula to be an indie gem in the long run.  The problems however weigh it down heavily. The biggest being the length. Look, I'm not a person who is always on the more length = better bandwagon: games like Portal have shown that short and concise experiences can really work even for higher price points. But note how I said there concise: that the story was able to be told within the bounds of the runtime. Unfortunately for Lucifer Within Us, that's not the case. Just as the game seems to be hitting its stride and the world opens up and the intrigue is peaking......the credits roll. It makes you feel unfulfilled, makes you feel like the sin of gluttony is your own personal demon. It then exposes some of the cracks in the game's shell. Where certain presentation choices end up causing a conflict with the contradiction system due to you falling down a rabbit hole of “no,  that sound was made, someone has to be lying”. Where the game is definitely not helping you with what EXACTLY it wants you to do, even though it seems right in front of you. Where the cool demon influence system starts to eliminate characters quickly that don't seem to have a motive. You still are enjoying yourself, you still appreciate the design work along with the layered voice acting, but you just keep on thinking that the game, with maybe a bit more put into it, could have changed the landscape of narrative games in the detective genre.  That's what makes this hard. I recommend the game overall: it's a game you should try, but the price point is a hard one to swallow for those who want to regulate their own game spending. If you have the disposable funds, I'd play it now, but others, I'd wait for a deep sale, as it's one to try one day....and maybe a case or two will be added at that point.

When you first fire up Superbrothers: Sword & Sworcery EP, you are greeted by a mysterious cigar smoking figure with the following introduction: "We are profoundly grateful that you have chosen to participate in this experimental treatment for acute soul-sickness." That's as good an indication as any that this isn't your average run of the mill entertainment. While the core gameplay matches that of a classic 2D point and click adventure, the distinct elements that feed the whole are original and uniquely charming and the sum of their parts makes for an experience that is quite unlike anything else. You will be presented with the option to tweet the messages that pop up throughout your quest, and as hinted at earlier, I guess this is meant to function as an experiment in social networking and provide real-time feedback and meta-commentary while you play. It's a novel way of integrating real-world social networks and to my knowledge hasn't been attempted before in this medium in such fashion. This is a game that isn't afraid to be self-conscious and sometimes poke fun at itself and at what it is trying to achieve. The ironic tone of the dialogue makes this clear from the onset, and although I enjoyed the wry wit and humour on display, there were times when I couldn't help but think what might have been if the developers hadn't felt the need to abruptly break the fourth wall so often and had taken this wonderful thing they had created at face value and just ran with it. Because there is real magic to be found here.  While playing Sword & Sworcery, I'm reminded once again that aiming for fidelity in computer generated graphics can be something of a double-edged, well, sword. While there's something to be said for games that push polygons to their limits and dazzle and awe with their polished "cinematic realism", what the developers of S&S EP have achieved with simple 2D sprites and pixelated lo-fi is nothing short of... magical. Superbrothers: Sword & Sworcery EP is, without a doubt, one of the most beautifully designed and evocatively atmospheric games I have ever witnessed. The beauty and artistry of the visual landscape never cease to fascinate. It can't be stated often enough that a huge part of what gives the game its one-of-a-kind otherworldly feel is the stellar work of musical genius Jim Guthrie. The hauntingly atmospheric music and brilliantly minimalist sound design make this wonderful mystical world come to life. Sometimes, while wandering around, I would just stop and not do anything at all and just look and listen and just try to soak it all in. But of course there's more to this whole strange and fantastic adventure, there's a mystery to be solved, secrets to be uncovered, moon phases to be observed, hidden things to be clicked on, places to be discovered, monsters to be fought, and a story to be told and experienced and remembered and cherished. I can't but recommend Superbrothers: Sword & Sworcery EP in the strongest terms. It's a wonderful thing to behold.

It's maybe tower defense at its core, but its done in such a unique fashion that it honestly never feels like that's what I'm playing. In fact, it feels completely different than anything I've played before. There's a heart at the center, and then there's all the gross baddies trying to invade it. You're tasked with creating and connecting organs together in order to fend them off. Connect this organ to that one, now you've got a wall. That one to this one, now you've got a thorny ring of defense. The type of organs connected and even the direction you connect them from will result in different creations. Experimentation is key. In fact with the "learn by experimentation" mechanics and overall presentation this game feels quite a lot like some creepy old science experiment you've gotten yourself into.  Tutorials are available, but there's much to learn beyond them, and at least personally I feel like finding out how all the organs interact with each other is a big draw of the experience. I'd recommend avoiding them as long as you can. (I found the sandbox mode actually worked great as a less stressful playground for finding out how things work.) The game is frantic and fast. I die a lot, and quickly. But each time I learn more about how things work, and that coupled with the quick nature of it makes it very easy to fall into the "Just one more!" loop. It's all a bit strange, a little creepy perhaps, and very engaging.

To start off - if you currently have an Oculus Rift, stop reading and purchase this game right now... It's ok, I'll wait for you to do it. Done? Good, because this game currently has the best native support for VR available right now.  A perfectly realized virtual cockpit with great functionality and UI suited for VR.  The sense of immersion is quite spectacular, and the game itself is also very fun. For those without a rift, the game is quite good as well.  It places you on the moon (or mars) in control of a lander type craft, in which you perform missions for experience and cash, with which you can upgrade your lander's capabilities.  The lander handles as a low gravity vehicle would handle, and with practise you can pull off some very impressive manouevers.  The types of missions available range from surveying certain locations, searching for misplaced or lost cargo and transportation of cargoes. There is a multiplayer component as well, though I have to attest i haven't really played much of this mode (was having way too much fun in the single player portion of the game) Overall, I'd heartily recommend the game to anyone with a slight interest in space exploration - and if you have a Rift this is a must purchase.

A remaster of an NES game of the same name. That being said, it is mechanically identical to the original game and you can even toggle between the remastered sounds/visuals and the original. Awesome! They even allow you to choose your gender however its a temporary cosmetic and for the most part, the game will be the same regardless of which gender you choose because you will end up playing as the same "creatures" your boy/girl transforms into. So at its core it is very basic. You progress through the levels killing enemies until you reach the boss. Your character then transforms into a different creature with different combat mechanics and strengths/weaknesses. The game can be very punishing to players like myself who never played retro before due to the types of challenges that we don't normally see in games nowadays. Things like limited health pickups, a punishing death (having to fight your way to the boss all over again and losing all your special items) and of course every enemy in the game hurting you if you simply touch it, including invincible enemies so you really have to plan your movement which in it of itself is very limited. I think the game suffers in the respect that it had to adhere so closely to the original. It would've been nice to see changes made to the jump mechanics (a hold jump that results in a higher jump would've been awesome) as well as a options for defensive play like dodge rolling or shielding would've been welcome (the character holds a shield at the start but can't use it. Lame!) I found that at my skill level, I was unable to beat the 2nd boss (Mummy dragon) without a self-revive which is a very rare item you can obtain through gameplay or by RNG obtain when you die. This means that 9/10 of my playthroughs to get to the boss was pretty much a waste of time since I  wasn't going to survive without the item anyway. You will end up amassing a ton of coins but nothing to buy once you purchase all the vendor items throughout the part of the world you have unlocked. I wish the new devs could've taken some liberties and added a shop that sold self revive potions for around 1000 coins a pop which is quite costly but rewards you for persevering through all those failed playthroughs.  The devs could've also taken liberties by making the boss battles a little more interesting. I found that for the most part, the difficulty lies in being damaged and stun locked by simply touching the bosses. I would understand it if the bosses had a second phase where they became much more dangerous and unleashed a kind of deadly aura so you would have to keep your proximity 80% of the time but due to the ridiculously high speeds the bosses move in, you will find yourself stun locked to death in a matter of seconds your first couple of plays through (that is, if you even manage to make it to the boss). Now something positive about the game. I think the remastered visuals are stunning. They are so damn good I could just sit in place and admire them all day. I can tell the visual artists had a field day with it. Sometimes they would take liberties into their own hands and change things up from the original game but somehow keep the overall flow with the level design consistent. I like to toggle between the remaster and retro graphics and am shocked at how empty the rooms in the retro version are but how detailed and alive the remaster's backgrounds are. So mad, mad props for creating an eye candy of a remaster. Perhaps I am looking at this game the wrong way, from the lens of a gamer who grew up on a slightly dumbed down style of play with more complex worldbuilding but I think the game certainly stands on its own merits for being very challenging but also ahead of its time in terms of the creature swap mechanic that allows you to explore the same levels over and over only to discover new hidden pathways that lead to treasure. Also I can't get over how great the visuals are--- mwah! WonderBoy the Dragon's Trap is a game worth looking into if you have a buck to spare or get it in a bundle, but for a good number of players, I reckon this game will be a huge pain to play through.

If you have paid attention to gaming journalism and marketing since Dark Soul's original release in 2011, no doubt you've seen the phrase "X is the Dark Souls of Y. " This serves as a signifier of the game's difficulty. These comparisons, however, end there and are strained at best and reductive at worst. Possibly the most infamous of these flimsy comparisons is GamesRadar's review of the 2017 Crash Bandicoot N-Sane Trilogy. The point I'm trying to make here and this review in general, are where these games differ in how they present their difficulty. Crash comes from a time that was still very much informed by the quarter stealing coin-op games of the arcade scene, and thus derives its difficulty from very acute attention to spatial awareness and timing. Playstation 1 era controls and systems, while at their core simple, are not what today's gamers are used to and don't help with the former. The platforms/shooter Cuphead has been called "Cup Souls" for its immense difficulty, despite it being derived from the intense influence of Japanese bullet hell games. These are renowned for their immensely twitchy gameplay that relies on, like Crash, spatial awareness and timing. Dark Souls is another beast entirely. While it is comparable to the coin-ops in that most enemies kill you in 3 hits, the comparisons mostly end there. Unlike other RPGs such as Skyrim, you have to understand multiple systems at work, and button mashing will not help you. There are no magic map markers or fast travel systems (in the first 2/3s of the game at least in the latter's case). The only form of checkpoint is the game's bonfires, bases spread across the map (at max 3 in an area) that allow you to heal, restore your estus (the only way to heal outside of the bonfires besides magic spells), and spend souls in order to level up. There's no regenerating health or magic. This game does not hold your hand. It makes you explore, go slowly through the game, and use trial and error to find out what style of play works for you. The former games don't have this malleability. They have to be played in the exact right way to get from place to place. Dark Souls, however, lets you make your own path. There's no one solution to the many seemingly insurpassable obstacles that the game throws at you and the tried and true solution of most western RPGs, button mashing, is really the only patently wrong answer. The game gifts all the tools one needs right from the start. The parry, riposte, and backstab techniques are a very intuitive way to deal with a majority of the game's mob. The game stresses that enemies should be dealt with 1-on-1 and groups will often split up to help the player out with this. There is no all encompassing class like Skyrim's infamous Stealth Archer, you build your character the way you are comfortable with and it will work for you. The game awards trial and error. That's why the soul recovery system is so fantastic. If you weren't aware, once you die in Dark Souls you leave behind a glowing green pile of the souls that you have collected up to that point. These souls are a dual purpose mechanic that functions as both the game's currency for shops and XP for leveling up. I offer a 3rd function for them though: motivation to learn from your mistakes. You have to embrace the "You Died" screen; you should be learning from each death. If you don't, you lose the souls you worked so hard to get. The game awards endurance and hope. These two tools will be more powerful than any weapon on your way to the end of this game. It suffers from a third act that was rushed for time constraints. This part of the game doesn't capture the tense feelings and dread of the former part of the game, you are likely way more than powerful enough for each boss. All in all, it keeps aesthetic and requirement for strategy all the way through, so this 3rd act isn't a chore or boring. It just isn't as captivating as the earlier portions. I'd recommend this game if you have patience and a little time on your hands; a normal first time play through takes anywhere between 1 and 3 hours on average. The multiplayer in this game is really unique. If you have humanity, you can sacrifice some to unhollow yourself. This allows you to summon the help of certain NPCs and other players at various points of the game which can help for particularly tough bosses. On my first play through I had a lot of trouble maintaining humanity though and I didn't get to utilize this feature much, I had to beat Ornstein and Smough all by myself. That tested my will. Some real life assistance will surely be helpful in this game. However, reversing your hollowing also sets you up to be invaded by other players, in line with this game's faction systems. Various factions give you access to benefits such as new weapons or magic as you level up your affinity with that faction. This leveling system is based on items that you can recover from either helping or invading other players, and occasionally found in the world as loot. The invasion system is where a lot of the role playing comes in. There's a certain forest area that is guarded by a certain faction. Joining that faction and murdering incoming players is a great way to mine humanity and souls and faction items and also makes the forest hunters not attack you once you enter that area. While it does add more depth to the experience, it can be frustrating when you're in a bind nowhere near a bonfire with no idea of what to do next just to be invaded and have all your hard work erased. This isn't common but when it does happen, it can be quite the setback. However, you'll be used to setbacks with this game. The matchmaking is based on what your strongest weapon is, so if you're still trying to orient yourself in the game, maybe don't try to level up your weapons early on to avoid highly experienced griefers. That all being said, the multiplayer isn't very active as of right now. In terms of content, this is a 1:1 port of the Prepare to Die edition that includes the game and DLC. This version fixes frame rate issues that blighted Blightown and various other portions of the game. The textures are updated and are noticeably nicer than the last generation versions of this game. I originally had this on PS3 in 2014 but I "didn't get it" and dropped it after failing to get past a certain early boss that I must have tried upwards of 50 times. Even with that little bit of time spent, the graphics are noticeably nicer. Its nothing amazing; current gen games like Bloodborne and Dark Souls 3 look a lot nicer on their native consoles than this does, but the aesthetic is still here in all its gothic and depressing glory. If you played on PC, however, most of the function updates included in the mod DSFix cover the issues that console gamers had no solution for. This remaster is purely for console gamers who missed their chance last gen or those that want a more consistent and less buggy experience than what they had on PS3 or Xbox360. Good luck, Chosen Undead.

Sistema de combate medio tosco pero entretenido. High fantasy con algunas vuelta de tuerca que lo hace destacar. Los personajes y las relaciones entre ellos es de las mejores cosas del juego, aunque hay algunos que, al menos a mis ojos, recibieron menos cariño de parte de los devs comparados con personajes como Alistar y Morrigan. El punto mas fuerte del juego es el pacing narrativo, que incluso con sus limitaciones técnicas y de diseño te mantiene enganchado durante toda la campaña principal y sus campañas extra (unas buenas 90 horas en mi caso). Algo que no puedo decir de la mayoría de las cosas que tengo la suerte de jugar.

The Multiplayer is really adictive, and it works really great, at least in my country (Spain) I have no problem finding games really quick, and I've played around 30 matches so far, none of them with a hint of lag, or high ping issues, and that's fantastic in this kind of game. Other people is reporting problems with the Performance. I don't get it either... I'm running it with a couple of GTX660Ti, all maxed out, and 60 fps steady... 60% of the campaign already completed and no performance problems whatsoever. The only negative point in my opinion is the lack of content so far. A few more maps would be nice, and even more missions for the coop mode. 8/10. I'm really enjoying it.

My 12 year old begged for this game. I looked at the title and poster and said 'no way'! He then looked at me and said it wasn't fair, I didn't trust him. Then I thought back to the time when I was 12 and snuck out to the movies with my friend to see Nightmare on Elm Street after being told I couldn't. What would my mum know, ha! I was mature! So with that in mind and seeing small changes that are telling me my son is growing up, he is a gamer and one way or another, he will find a way to play this game (especially if one of his friends are playing it) we sat down and he had to explain to his dad and I why he wanted to play it (specifics) Yes, it was because his friends are playing it, the you tubers he is allowed to watch are playing it but it was when he said it was a hard strategy game I thought this isn't about watching 'horror' for him. It was about playing a hard game. So we all decided to watch the trailer, we told him what we didn't like about the trailer, about horror topics in general and why it can be dangerous to watch graphic things all the time and he understood. We also set up rules. No joining online chat, no playing it with friends when they come over, no talking about it at school and he had to be ok if we sat in his room to watch him okay it every now and then. Deal. So we downloaded the game and watched him play it. The graphics aren't good enough for me to say its a 'horror' game. Yes there is blood, yes the music is creepy, yes there is 1 person in the team who is the murderer. But I was surprised you didn't see graphic 'muder'. It happens so quick and from what I saw, my sons character had his back to the screen and Freddy Kruger lunges at him that you didn't see him being 'stabbed' as such (I can't believe I just typed that!). However you do have the opportunity to run and hide a, get healed to fight again, get to the safe point and help your team mates out by helping them get to the safe point or waiting for them to go together as a team to the safe point. However if you die, the killer delightfully pick ups his victim and puts them on a hook, but again it isn't graphic enough to be grossed out. Look, am I happy about this game, no. Does my son know I'm not happy, yes. I can only monitor his behaviour and pray he gets bored and stops playing it. He is growing up in a world I don't relate too and I'm not sure I like. When I was his age, kids didn't even wear watches (they were expensive things grown ups wore) and when you played in the street after school, you knew it was home time when the street lights came on! We don't even let our kids play in the streets anymore. Its about putting down the ground rules, monitoring behaviour and trusting you've raised a kid who knows right from wrong and when they make the wrong choice you are there to hell them through it. All we know is as parents its our responsiblity to set the ground rules and watch for any changes in behaviour but to also show him we trust him as he starts to get older.
It is a very good game, I definitely recommend it

Я проходил эту игру несколько раз и очень жду продолжения, этого, не побоюсь слова, шедевра... Да, это вам не Watch Dogs 1/2. Эта игра по своему особенна, некоторым она может показаться полным бредом... Но ребят, у всех разные вкусы и предпочтения...  Что хочется увидеть в будущем... It’s been 3 months sense i completed LIS and i have not written a review for it until now. Reason for that is that I couldn’t at that time, i felt like i should wait to write this review, and i feel nows the time to write it. This game i have never played anything like it. The gameplay I Love it even though it ain’t open world. There’s quite a bit of stuff to read and look at. Like posters notes graffiti and of course max’s diary. :) Now the main protagonist of the game is a student named Maxine Caulfield or max that goes to Blackwell academy who soon realizes that she can rewind time and change course of events and can cause consequences, talk bout that in a bit. Now the story it is by far the best, no other story has ever touched my heart and soul like this one has. It has funny weird kinda spooky crazy happy romantic love goofy very sad cryfull emotional and most of all fun moments. Also you investigate a mystery about the strange disappearance of fellow student Rachel Amber, find clues tracks and anything to help you solve the mystery. Now each decision you make will definitely impact the past present and future if you rewind so be very careful and choose wisely. Take all the hella time you need as you can rewind XD and don’t hella rush thru the game not a good idea. I even got attached to a few characters Love you Max Caulfield and Chloe Price ❤❤❤❤ in the end i bursted out crying so sad. Changed me completely and left me a scar on my heart and soul ❤❤❤❤❤                   Very hella amazing story to me its more than a game it’s something i cant even explain. ❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤❤repeat/10 Will play this over and over and over again repeat!!! P.S. I wish there was a Mixtape mode so i could hear all the songs whenever i want too.
