Перед нами очередной платформер, стилизованный под ретро-игры, в котором нам придется большую часть игры прыгать с одной платформы на другие. Все бы ничего: неплохой дизайн уровней, саундтрек, игра чем-то напоминает советскую фантастику - словом, поиграть можно, но всю игру портит кривая физика. Дело в том, что Yury кроме графики той эпохи приносит и неудобную физику, чем страдали многие игры того времени: резкие и неуверенные прыжки, резкие развороты в воздухе, скользящая ходьба, будто наш персонаж на роликах. Из-за всего этого очень тяжело рассчитывать прыжок на следующую платформу: то недолет, то перелет; часто просто проскальзываешь всю платформу, а если стоишь на краю - соскальзываешь вниз. Для меня это критично, я люблю, когда свое движение и прыжки в подобных платформерах можно уверенно и твердо рассчитывать. Yury к сожалению имеет данный недостаток из-за чего я не могу пройти дальше второго чекпойнта на первом уровне. Также огорчен отсутствием русского языка, если разработчик сам русский.

Fico com pena de não recomendar porque o time que criou o jogo é pequeno e formado por programadores independentes, mas infelizmente tenho que ser honesto. A ideia é boa, os personagens são interessantes o trabalho em pixel art é bem legal. Mas infelizmente o jogo é muito monótono e não dá vontade de continuar jogando. Pra quem ainda assim quer jogar, usar um controle é algo muito recomendado, já que jogar com teclado e mouse é bastante frustrante. Infelizmente o controle de XBox 360 não funciona bem, o que faz com que andar pra frente seja mapeado no direcional pra cima, andar pra trás seja no direcional pra baixo e não dá pra descer das plataformas (a não ser que aperte pra baixo no teclado). Também não dá pra mirar com o  direcional analógico, jogando com o controle do 360. São vários probleminhas e eu confio que o jogo pode melhorar quando sair da fase early access, mas eu me arrependo de gastar dinheiro com ele.

Wo soll man hier anfangen, das Spiel an sich ist recht kurz. Ich habe dafür rund 2 stunden gebraucht. Ich persönlich habe mir mehr von dem Spiel erwartet,da ich das Charakter Design recht cute fand und der Art style an sich. Doch die Story war von Anfang bis ende recht "meh" es gab keinen spannungs bogen rein gar nichts, es fühlte sich so an als hätten die Entwickler zum ersten ma eine Story geschrieben (was natürlich seien kann) aber Trotzdem für den Preis von fast 11€ hätte ich wesentlich mehr erwartet da das gameplay auch recht uninteressant ist. rd gibt hier und dort ma gute Rätzel aber das war es auch. Trotzdem muss man auch das außenrum beurteilen, und das Spiel an sich ist wunderschön von der Grafik her. Die Charaktere sehen auch recht niedlich aus. Fazit: Es ist einfach zu teuer für das, was man geboten bekommt, Story zu kurz und auch teilweise schlecht, keine wirklich Kniffligen rätselte und das gleich gamplay (für die kurze gametime). Doch grafisch ist das ganze Spiel recht interessant und alles wurde recht süß und wahrscheinlich auch mit liebe gemacht.

"Holy Potatoes! A Weapon Shop?" is a game about running your own blacksmithing service, in order to earn money and provide weapons to adventurers. The kind of item you try to sell the adventurer will determine how much they level-up and how much money you gain, so there's a bit of thought to be put into what you wanna sell and to who. The game's pretty cute overall, with tons of references to other games. I thought the game was enjoyable until I finished the first area, then it felt a bit too tedious to continue. I might eventually pick it back up one day, but currently, I cannot recommend it.

Кароч переписываю обзор по-новой. Ща я вам расскажу свою шикарную историю. Жил был сервер, назывался гееу. Было там всего обильно, и местная администрация вечно баловала нас своими подарками, компенсируя все то ГОВНО, которым является эта игра на официальных серверах. Потом он закрылся к ебеням из-за отзыва лицензии и админской торговлей имба-пушками, и буквально на следующий день открылось это. Я пять лет играл, вы, жадные ебаные свиньи блядские, без доната в корейскую гринделку, чтобы в итоге просто все проебать, ибо трансфера даты не было. Отличный скам, пошли в пизду сука, сервер кстати говно, если у вас нет 500 баксов на покупку бумажной брони, которая годится только в ссаном вайроне вордоев доить. Тупа петушиный угол. At first it was massively fun, for a couple of hours until I noticed the same game mechanics and patterns appear over and over. After that, it felt grindy and repetitive a lot.  I really loved the game's idea and how it worked. It just seems to be rushed and not finished, there's no such thing like evolving to the stone age humans, overall, the evolvement system seems to be not rewarding enough, you barely get to walk on two legs and it is kind of useless to be honest. There could be so much said more but you have to really question yourself if you'd pay around 30€ for 5h approximately of content and then you'd grind through pain until you finished it because as long as everything seems new and different, as I said, you'll notice that you'll encounter nothing new except more grind and pain.  I'd strongly recommend the game if it would be more finished because at the current state, it's barely a playable game for longer than few days.

Pause button doesn't pause the game. stuff like this really puts me off the game, it also makes beating the tutorial boss way harder than it needs to be.  Had a friend essentially recreate the tutorial level in Unity and it was way more fluid to control and things work as they should work.

Tried it for a bit. I set it to match CS:GO's settings, and I was trying out different senses. I tried 2.4 sens, which for me is pretty high for CS:GO, and allows you to make 180 degree turns with minimal effort. Apparently, Aim Lab doesn't care because with the "CS:GO" settings, you had to put a lot of effort with that sens to even do a 90 degree turn. Kind of disappointed. Hopped into CS:GO after and tried my normal CS:GO sens (1.7) and it was much easier to turn and stuff than the much higher sens in Aim Lab. I came to the conclusion that Aim Lab is simply inaccurate. Regardless, as most pro's that AREN'T sponsored by Aim Labs would recommend, just play the game you want to get good at. That's the best way to get better aim at the game you want to get better at, don't use some random aim trainers.

I thought this might be a game that, despite its simple mechanics, could keep me going for hours upon hours (longer than I currently have played).  I'm OK with the grind as long as it feels like it's getting me somewhere.  But there came a point in the game where the grind turned to tedium and eventually became boring because things weren't progressing any longer.  This is especially true since there doesn't seem to be any rhyme nor reason to the weapon/armor balance in this game.  Items that seem like they should be better than what you've been using for the past 10 levels just aren't, so the time you've used gathering materials to even make those items feels like a waste. Top that off with quests that seem unsolvable except with the best RNG odds, and there are parts where progression all but stalls and you feel you are just grinding because there's nothing else productive to do.  This is especially frustrating with the quests that actually control progression... if you can't solve the quest, you can't unlock the next stage or unlock something else that may be vital to moving forward.   So, you are very much at the mercy of the RNG gods for the most part. At this point I'm going to have to recommend people wait with purchasing this game until, perhaps, there are content changes/additions that make it worthwhile at later levels to continue.

Мой дорогой друг, PAYDAY2. Бывший дорогой друг. Я купил эту игру ещё много лет назад и полюбил с первого взгляда за всё, что в ней было. Отдавал ей своё время и свои старания. Когда-то я мог назвать её своей самой любимой игрой. Преодолел каждый контракт, когда существовало лишь 4 уровня сложности. В поте лица прошёл через сложнейший (нелогичный и дизбалансный) One Down, через какое-то время переименованный в Death Sentence. Но уже тогда ко мне и ко многим другим начало приходить осознание того, что каждое новое DLC - очередной гвоздь в крышку гроба, куда алчные разработчики решили похоронить эту игру, некогда имевшую высокий потенциал. И они это сделали на официальном уровне, однажды отказавшись от ее спонсирования и раздав 5 миллионов бесплатных копий. Но разработчики поняли, что придумать более успешную дойную корову, чем PAYDAY2, они не в силах и снова стали её "поддерживать". То, что стало происходить с игрой, начиная с года так 2017-ого или даже раньше, стало настоящим плевком в лица тех, кто эту её искренне любил. PAYDAY2 превратился в сплошной хаос. Море DLC, убивающих баланс и атмосферу. Комьюнити, состоящее из людей, получивших игру бесплатно или за 25 рублей. Не поддающийся логике античит. Много всего. Это больше не симулятор ограблений, а кооперативная песочница. И даже dead game-флешмоб под каждым новым DLC не был услышан. Те, кто породили PAYDAY2, её же и убили и без всякого стыда и уважения к своему детищу продолжают выдавливать из неё всё, что можно, лишь бы это принесло какой-то доход. Покойся с миром, друг.

I rarely leave reviews. I bought the founders pack and tested alpha so I have more experience than most with this game. I had so much hope as I love the survival/open-world/MMO genre. Here is the problem. Nothing is actually that fun in the game. In other MMO's it's worth grinding to get better gear so you can unlock new abilities, mounts, etc. You are grinding to unlock more interesting mechanics that increase the quality of game play. In this game you do un-fun things, to reward yourself with more un-fun things, to go to do more un-fun things. Run up to monster, attack twice, dodge, attack twice, dodge. Get 20-30 meat, run back buy more food. Rinse and repeat. This is a cookie cutter survival game where the only uniqueness is actually a hindrance to game play instead of an addition. This game is just a grind that has no sense of community or attachment to the world around you. I already payed so they already got me, but don't let them get you. Watch one video you will see you've watched them all. Also, how is this an MMO? Nothing you do relies on the multiplayer aspect and there is one class that specifically does melee damage with nearly the same animation for each of the whopping 4 weapons. My biggest problem with this game is that it isn't even CLOSE to what it tried to be and that was consciously not made clear before release. Game tout's PvP and territory battles when that will not be here for YEARS (If the studio really even plans to try to rectify this).  The mobs do not drop anything interesting, there is no sense of surprise in this game. Each monster drops the same thing everytime, no RNG, no rare loot. Just grind to craft everything and then watch durability before you need to go make another because they run out very fast. Just another studio that probably tried their best at the start, realized how hard it is to make a good game. And then went down the path that most studios do. Make a sub-par game and try to make up for it with marketing and community. No community could save this game. If I've learned one thing. It's how to spot games like this in advanced and not get excited. Good games have trailers with actual game play and have dev-blogs that go into the actual game. Not a vague statement/article that gives us no real indication on the direction of the game. -1 for Enplex Games on this one.

Представьте, что Saints Row 5 изнасиловало бы сразу восемь беременных телепузиков-латентных натуралов. В итоге, через 9 месяцев на свет появилось бы это - Agents of Mayhem. Немного жалею, что купил игру на старте. Если кто еще в раздумьях - стоит ли брать сейчас? Совет – нет, обождите скидки, выпросите в качестве подарка себе на день рождения гифтик этой игры, пропустите ее, переспите с кем надо, чтоб на халяву дали копию для обзора (нужное подчеркнуть), но, не тратьте свои деньги на эту игру, да еще и за полную стоимость! Особо за игрой не следил. Знал, что ее делают ребята, создавшие серию Saints Row.  Периодически просматривал геймплейные ролики, если попадались на глаза. Зрелище удручающее. Не знаю, чего именно я ожидал, если по увиденному уже было понятно, что Агенты – пустышка. И я ведь ее еще умудрился купить -_- Игру прошел. Ушло 23 часа (сюжетные миссии, побочные задания + собирашки). Правда, прошел не на 100 %. Сильно наскучило. Под конец уже просто решил пробежать оставшиеся основные задания сюжета. Вся игра проходит в городе Сеул. Локация довольно маленькая, пустынная. Исследовать *мир* игры не интересно. Некоторое время я еще бегал по окрестностям, но понял, что ничего интересного тут я не найду. Задания крайне однотипные: добеги туда-то, просканируй область, взломай или взаимодействуй с объектом, чтобы открыть вход на базу, убей всех противников, перестреляй генераторы. Так будет продолжаться 50 с лишним раз, а именно столько тут миссий.  Все базы противников на одно лицо.   видимо было лень рисовать уникальные локации под каждое задание. Нам придётся проходить по одному и тому же подвалу десятки раз. Возникает даже чувство дежа-вю: вроде я уже тут был или меня плющит после вчерашних грибочков-мухоморчиков?  Игра сильно *оптимизирована эффективными манагерами*, т.е. порезана во всем. Тут нету магазинчиков с костюмчиками, нельзя покупать оружие, транспорт. Деньги можно лишь тратить на покупку модификаций - умений. Каждый из 13 персонажей владеет своей уникальной и единственной пушкой, которую нельзя заменить на более мощную, нельзя проапгрейдить. Можно лишь сменить ее расцветку.  Тоже относится и к костюмам героев. Выполняя задания, есть шанс заполучить новый насисьник, который представляет собой всего лишь перекраску стандартного. Красота! С транспортом также: постепенно будут появляться новые виды машин, которые можно будет переодеть в *новые цветастые лифчики*, находя их во время миссий. Радиостанций нет во время езды на транспорте. Присутствуют ряд музыкальных треков, которые можно листать, если едешь на ворованном транспорте. На личном почему-то слушать приходиться одну мелодию. Переключить ее нельзя. Может это у меня какой-то глюк или же некая фишка игры о_О Хорошо хоть Агенты имеют собственный набор навыков и умений. На этом спасибо. Всех я не осилил открыть. Меня хватило на 10-рых (Просканируй локацию, войди на базу, всех убей, выйди из базы, потом беги к новому маркеру на карте, где необходимо будет пройти небольшую миссию, играя за нового агента, после чего он станет доступен для выбора в Ковчеге. Так будет для каждого героя). Скука, уныние от прохождения Агентов и новое залитое видео на Порнохабе – вот что оказалось препятствием для достижения 100% прохождения игры. С оптимизацией тоже плачевно. В некоторых местах, а именно в битве с Августом на сцене, просадки были до 22 кадров на максимальных настройках при разрешении монитора 1080р (конфиг: 980ti + 4790k). Такая же картина могла еще наблюдаться во время большого количества взрывов.  Из положительных сторон я бы выделил: - Приятную графику. - Есть как симпатичные женские персонажи, так и страшные, а значит обделенные не начнут ныть и наезжать на разработчиков игры: “А как же мы? Доколе вы будете вставлять красоток в игры?!” - Все агенты отлично раскрыты, как личность посредством диалогов. - Обилие мультяшных заставок. Хотелось бы увидеть полнометражный мультик в таком же исполнении по вселенной игры. Из отрицательных: - Скучные однообразные миссии. - Одинаковые вражеские базы. - Отсутствие кастомизации персонажей. - Мало негров. - Мало игрового контента. В игру больше не хочется возвращаться после одного прохождения. - Оптимизация не секси. - Я голодный, а склеить бутер из батончика и колбаски лень. - Кто-то уже полтора часа сидит в туалете.

Il prezzo è mooolto più alto di quello che vale in confronto a missioni più belle che sono uscite a minor prezzo o che sono già nel gioco base. Se siete veramente fan di PAYDAY2 e volete supportare lo sviluppo di PAYDAY3 compratela pure, ma se volete semplicemente una missione in più, non fatelo ci sono già moooolte missioni fatte meglio nel gioco base.

Playtime to finish story: 6 - 7 Hours Well unlike the fist game Outlast 2 is a big let down let me tell you why. Story:  Is absolut confusing with no answers at all. If you have to google what is even happening than you know you failed to deliver a good story ingame. Gameplay:  Is boring and most of the time you just run away like an maniac or hide in tall grass to dodge enemies. There are sometimes unfair part where you fail just because you don't know what you are suppose to do. Some enemies (The big ones) are using wallhacks  where you can't hide cause they find you anyway somehow that leads to: Running away > stealth Ambient: The ambient is good but it wasn't scary at all. In the first Outlast you had a really scary prison complex but in Outlast 2 you walk around in a forest like area and sometimes in a dream like world (where you can't actually die). The horror in Outlast comes only from the few Jumpscares and panic situations. The Gore and brutality in this game is insane but not scary. Overall Outlast 2 is a big let down that never comes close to the great first part.  I would give it a 5/10

The game had a promising start.  Very bioshockey.  The shooting mechanics were meh, but so was Bioshock's. The game locked me into a kill-box with an un-ending supply of spawning monsters and it gave me the hint to "find an alternate way in."  The alternate way was obvious, a locked doorway but I could not find out how to open it..  Then suddenly, it opened on it's own.  It was then I realized what the trigger for this "puzzle" was;  You run out of ammo and depleat your healthpacks.  When you are limping to your death, the door opens on it's own.  It was the "he's suffered enough" tripwire. It was at this point that I noticed the number of remaining f#cks I had to give began to deplete rapidly.  Three minutes later the game put me in similar situation.  At this point, I was completely out of f#cks to give.  I was forced to quit and uninstall the game.  Such a shame that my inventory was so limited.  Maybe your experience will be better than mine.

I really did like this game, the story was interesting and we got to see the ties between AC 4 and AC 3, with other references and details to past AC games, however the reason why I have to give a negative review is the gameplay. - More than a few times I encountered unresponsive controls that either killed me, or made me restart a mission which was annoying, but livable, none were game breaking. - The AI seems dumber than Black Flag, which is impressive - Almost everything from Black Flag was copied and pasted, with a few changes - The game is a muddy mess that can't decide if it wants to be AC 3 or AC 4   It takes almost everything great from AC 4 (my favorite AC game) and makes them slightly worse SHIP GAMEPLAY: -AC4: Cannot volley cannon fire but the cannons make up for it in damage, cannot free aim swivel gun but automatically aims at weak spots and does a good amount of damage, swivel gun during boardings dont have many shots but can shoot through the sides of the ship, cannons take too long to reload but it's livable because the smoke from the shots obscure your vision until they are reloaded -Rogue: you fire a second volley but the volley doesnt do damage, can ONLY free aim your swivel gun and does a lot less damage, swivel gun has a lot more shots during boarding but cant shoot through the sides of the ship making it almost useless while boarding larger ships, the cannons reload slightly faster but the smoke clouds after shooting your cannons is insanely large and youre a sitting duck because you cant tell whats happening, EXPLORATION: AC 3 was fantastic with the forest exploration aspect, and AC 4 was OK at island exploration because it felt too sparse but the islands were either big enough to spend hours on or small enough to spend minutes on, so it was the perfect balance. AC 4 had a large map with several main large Islands with a few docking areas, AC 3 had a few areas that were densely populated with things to do and collect I would describe the exploration of AC 3 as "rewarding, relaxing, and regular" and AC 4 as "decent destination, beautiful exploration, amazing transportation"  Rogue has 3 massive areas to explore all crammed with medium sized areas to explore that are cram-packed with collectibles, and making your way from one small docking area to the next felt like a linear path because you have to maneuver around large islands that you cant dock at.  I would describe Rogue's exploration as "A clusterf*** of meaningless collectibles and repetitive obstacles" The Collectibles of AC R is probably the worst part of Rogue's gameplay, not because there's so many types of collectibles, or parts to each collectible, or they're all so widespread. It's because the rewards are worth it. 100% completing this game seems more of a chore to get rewards than an experience to be rewarded for playing. One last thing, that's pretty petty on Ubisoft's part, was the main outfit of the game. You have a slightly different outfit in the mid section of the game, the same coat but missing the red under-jacket part. I assumed that you would automatically be given it during the game's story, but never got it. I completed the game with the "interim" outfit. It wasn't until after I beat the game that I found the Templar outfit in the shops. Why wouldn't they tell you that you unlocked the outfit, or automatically equip it when it's unlocked?  But the MOST confusing thing about this game is the false advertising of the hood. Shay Cormac does not have a hood in the game. In all the promotion videos and pictures, Shay is shown with a hood. The staple of the assassin's creed franchise. I hope whoever made the decision to tease us with a hood got fired.

Игру к прохождению не рекомендую, так как после её окончания возникает ощущение потраченного впустую времени. Концовка кажется мне смятой, сделанной на скорую руку.  С точки зрения постановки сценария наметила бы жирный минус. Сюжет игры я могла бы так же назвать клишированным и недоработанным. Я не прониклась историей главного героя, как и не ощутила глубины его характера. Всё то время чтения, что я отвела на эту новеллу, я  ждала куда более интересных фактов или сцен, способных лучше раскрыть главного героя (да и героев в целом),  чего я по итогу не получила.  Можно конечно писать, что здесь куда более сложный сюжет с четкой психологической и философской ноткой, что может быть и так, но преподношение этого в формате новеллы несколько скомканное и скудное.  Самый неприятный минус данной игры в автоматической блокировке, ввиду которой невозможно получить все достижения. Я не нахожу это необходимым и считаю, что лишать игрока права выбора не есть этичным.  Из плюсов стоило бы отметить, что в общем-то"Lily of the Valley" - это милая и короткая новелла с приятной рисовкой. Стоило бы оценить и то, как гармонично звучат оригинальные саундтреки к новелле.  Прорисовка спрайтов  и цг к новелле тоже неплохая, однако у меня возник вопрос по какой причине в игре содержится так мало спрайтов, изображения локаций.  Игра стоит свои 79 рублей, наверное, только из-за стараний художника, но не более.  Истинная цена новеллы, в моём трактовании, 45-50 рублей. И то, рекомендую брать по скидке, если таковая вообще будет.

If you are not a Star Wars fan and have been longing for a competent game you might want to wait for a discount. This game is not bad but it is also not good. It is okay. The graphics are quite nice and sometimes there are some beautiful scenery shots but the game is not very good optimized. There are parts in the levels where you get unavoidable stutter and in at least one level it is very noticeable. The story seems to be.. okay. Not enthralling or exciting but you won't suffer a total bore. The combat is fun but feels not done. I mean you have a lightsaber and force powers, yeah \o/. But you only get 2 variants of sabers and the move set of each is kind of limited. You have to spec into heavy attacks and they use force like your powers. Because of this and the strange heavy combo timing the combat very often boils down to dodge/parry -> counter with default light, light, light combo, repeat. I think this would have been way more fun if they had gone a bit more to the spectacle fighter side. 3 saber variants (normal, double, dual wield) with 3 stances each (light, balanced, heavy) would make for some variety. :) The number of powers is also limited. Using those that are there is fun but i'm missing powers like choke or lightning or healing/protection or even blind. Just something you can play and fiddle with after the novelty wears of after the first planets. The game is a bit glitchy and has issues in the quality of life department. Ragdolls glitching through the floor is common and i have yet to encounter a single cutscene that is skippable. You are even forced to watch the hole sit down / stand up animation at a savepoint and you can't do anything during those, which after a while is beginning to feel like a huge time waste. The cutscenes at the start of the game (before the main menu) take way too long. The game overall feels a bit unfinished or rushed. I would have expected more quality for this price or a lower price for this quality. Buy on discount if you don't have anything else to play. :) [edit]: A very nice feature is that you can change the difficulty on the fly (out of combat).
Not worth the £24 sale price and certainly not worth the non sale price of over £50. Game is just rubbish.

Pela minha experiência em Lego, diria que esse nem se compara com o resto da franquia Lego Batman, tem apenas 15 fases + o desafio dos 1 milhão de Studs. Sei que esse foi o primeiro Lego em mundo aberto, mas não muda o fato dele ser ruim e cheio de bugs, sem sombra de dúvidas esse foi o Lego com mais bugs que eu já vi, teve uma hora que consegui sair do mapa e não voltar mais, tive que reiniciar a fase desde o começo. História A história do game ocorre logo após os acontecimentos do "Lego Batman The Video Game", o Lex Luthor que está concorrendo a presidência acaba perdendo o premio de homem do ano para o Bruce, logo após perder o prêmio chega o Coringa e sua trupe e roubam o prêmio do ano, daí vai o Batman e o Robin atrás dele para tentar recupera-lo e botar o Coringa na cadeia de uma vez por todas, eles conseguem recuperar o prêmio e levam o Coringa para o Asilo Arkham. Depois disso, o Luthor vai em busca do Coringa para utilizar seu gás para fazerem os cidadãos votarem nele, agora seu objetivo é impedir que isso aconteça. Mundo Aberto O mundo aberto desses jogo é bem triste de ruim, começando pela parte dos Gold Bricks, logo após você coletar um Gold Brick tem um load que demora muito e isso acaba enchendo o saco, para liberar personagens é necessários enfrenta-los ou ter uma certa quantidade de Gold Bricks. O voo desse jogo é a pior coisa que eu já vi, é muito difícil de controlar... Personagens Os personagens são bem variados, cada um tem uma variedade de poderes, não é como no "Lego Batman 3" que tem milhares de personagens e todos tem praticamente os mesmo golpes. Nota Geral O jogo é cheio de bugs e loads longos, crasha bastante e também é bem chatinho ter que pegar os 100%, além de que tem dlc inacessível de maneiras "legais" na versão de Pc. Só compre se tiver em promoção, não vale a pena pega-lo fora da promoção.

I got this game because of the high percentage of positive reviews, but I should have known better, it's just another soulless cheap cash grab, which misuses the Early Access flag . You walk through the house, grab some keys and solve an easy "puzzle" to get out. It's super short, there's no story, bugs,  lvl design is abysmally poor and I could have sworn, I saw loads of the used assets in other UE4 games. If you don't get this game included in a bundle or just buy it because you want to have all games on steam - stay away. You'll find games with more depth and (horror)fun on gamejolt or itch.io for free.

The Forge tomb is fun to play however it takes around 10-15 minutes to solve what you're supposed to do and that's pretty much it. This whole DLC takes maximum 30 minutes to finish, so it does not worth its price unless you buy the Croft Edition or Season Pass separately -I really do hope they bring the Endurance mode instead of these challenge tombs- With this DLC you're going to get:  - The Challenge Tomb (you can play it in coop mode if you want, but that feature is literally a joke. You can solve the tomb on your own ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ There are two paths you can enter the tomb. You can do it solo or you need someone else to just shoot an arrow so you can land on another piece of land that will eventually take you to the same tomb from another angle lol THAT IS THE COOP) - The same freaking tomb you completed in main story, but wait, this time it's different because you can do it from the main menu. Also it has time and score attack challenges, only god knows why. - The Echoes of the Past side quest, which is just another mission that makes Lara only an interloper to the story. There is little to no combat, a little bit of parkouring and omg looong long cinematics of people talking about their grandmas hiding stuff. - Also you get an outfit, the same outfit with a different color if you complete the side quest, a weapon, the same weapon with a different color if you complete the side quest and the Grenadier skill.  Please Square Enix, there are no enemies in the game after you complete the main story, what are we supposed to do with a grenade launcher?

is the latest broken and buggy mess from Tero Lunkka, and while I certainly bear no ill will towards budding developers, the quality of his game-shaped objects are not improving. How bad is it? In no specific order: ❌ No introduction of any kind. Tutorial is a text menu with hard to read font and terrible formatting. ❌ Clipping everywhere. Objects not aligned with the terrain. Go around back to see an endless void behind surfaces ❌ Combat is a trainwreck. No way to lock on enemies. Constant need to change direction to face them. You can run from every encounter and avoid combat altogether, making it pointless to waste time on. Some enemies are unarmed entirely, rendering them harmless. ❌ Very high regeneration makes you nearly impossible to kill. Higher level enemies can barely be damaged at all. Probably requires crafting, but I couldn't figure out how to upgrade a single thing. ❌ No way to expand the minimap. The navigation bar is no help, pointing to locations not directly accessible ❌ No direction or purpose. You can take quests but receive useless or duplicate rewards. There's no clear state. ❌ Has sound effects, but no music. Long stretches of silence. ❌ Impossible to complete achievements without exploiting glitches If you've played any other Valkeala Soft games, you already know what to expect: A shoddily hobbled together UE4 asset pack with a title tacked on. While I do commend the developer for removing a broken achievement, 6 months later he's still failed to fix a glaring issue with the game: Ring 7 is inaccessible by any conventional means, because the ground underneath it isn't solid. There's a warp on its side that can't be located, either. Don't buy this unless you have a good reason to. Is it at risk for removal? Maybe, if Valve quality control ever decides to check in. : Collect every ring. Run around looking for giant green circles. The problem is Ring 7. To reach it,  . 30mins to 100%

This game is generic, boring, grindy and has so much missed potential towns are diverse and beautiful but have nothing to do,  sidequests are generic and boring, Like Bethesdas radiant quests. Второй и последний раз я пытаюсь в это играть. Передвижения со скоростью быстроходной улитки и вялые полёты в низкой гравитации, вот конёк этой игры. Абсолютное отсутствие динамики отбивает всякое желание проходить игру. Пока ты плавно, в виде мешка с дерьмом, летишь по воздуху, враги успевают навалить в тебя х*еву тучу урона и убить. Оружия для убийства болванчиков отсыпают до*уя, но по ощущениям это один и тот же мусор, но в разных вариациях. Сюжет? А он тут есть да? Я только слушал утомительные и бессмысленные диалоги. Такое ощущение будто ты, не считая врагов, находишься на планете в гордом одиночестве, слушая бесконечный пи*дёшь союзников, которые даже не соизволят показаться на люди. Абсолютно не зацепило и даже не интересно чем всё кончится.  Конечно, тому кто придумал сделать экшн-шутан в космосе, где тебя всеми силами пытаются замедлить и сделать лёгкой мишенью, безусловно нужно выдать премию Дарвина. Идея добавить низкую гравитацию  в корне ломает весь смысл экшна, где ты можешь активно "мансить" от пуль, быстро менять своё местоположение и выполнять прочие манёвры присущие шутерам. Ладно, можно сделать одну-две локацию с низкой гравитацией, типа для разрядки после жарких перестрелок на земле. Однако проходить так всю игру, это извините меня зае*ёт любого человека, привыкшего к динамичным играм. Игра чистко так...по стрелять пару вечеров и удалить.

Mildly entertaining racing game that gets old really fast. For a 2009 game the graphics still hold up fairly well, and it performs smoothly at 1920x1080 resolution. It's fun to race and take down opponent cars by slamming them into obstacles, but the experience grows stale too quickly. The environment is limited to one city so you'll see the same roads and scenery over and over again. The cars all handle pretty similarly so there's not much variety there, either. Where things get really frustrating is the user friendliness. The game doesn't do a very good job of showing where to go, so you can easily get lost while trying to race ahead of your opponents. Who wants to constantly be looking at the map while driving? It's easy to lose races because of this, and when it happens there's no way to quickly retry. You have to drive all the way back to the beginning, which can sometimes take a good 5 minutes. Given how repetitive this experience is, the game feels torturous and you feel like you are getting punished for not memorizing the city's layout. There are cars that you can't unlock because the online servers are dead forever, so they're just there to tease you. There's really not much here to recommend, to be honest.

(Too long to read? This review is also available in video format below for your convenience.) It's been fifteen long years since Sid Meier has given us the opportunity to conquer the cosmos with Alpha Centauri.  Set 600 years into the future where the earth is on the brink of destruction. The nations of the world send some of their best and brightest into space as a last ditch effort to colonize another planet. With an uncharacteristically utopian view on things, many nations have combined and cooperate with one another. For instance, Australia and Polynesia merge to become Polystralia, America, Canada, and Mexico become the American Reclamation Corporation and the entire continent of Africa becomes the African Union to name a few examples. These alliances take to the stars to begin anew on the wild frontier of alien planets.  Utilizing the core of Civ V, Beyond Earth is a turn-based strategy featuring hexagonal tiles on a grid without unit stacking. The terrain offers benefits in the same way its predecessor does. Mountains are impassible, hills provide extra defense, and rivers are difficult to cross. You start the game by picking a plot of land to build your first city, while each of the tiles offer different bonuses, such as food, production and energy. After founding your first city, you’re able to explore the alien landscape, searching for resource pods and artifacts for your explorers to excavate. It's here that one of the games’ first alterations comes to light: quests. Players will be given quests to complete and choices to make that help dictate the evolution of your civilization as well as providing additional buffs and bonuses.  Diplomacy is alive and well among these new colonies allowing you to trade with other civilizations, and you have access to all the diplomacy options seen in Civilization V, as well as the inclusion of favors which can be cashed in on later trades. The Alien life-forms are the game’s equivalent to barbarians albeit a lot stronger. They are however not as aggressive and will generally leave your units alone unless they happen to path towards a tile you’re occupying. This changes throughout the game though based on the Affinities you choose. Also if you go out of your way to attack an Alien or approach a nest, they will become hostile for a few turns. Certain bonuses and abilities make it worthwhile to actively exterminate these pests but later in the game that can become a diplomatic blunder with civilizations that are more sympathetic to alien life. The Affinities are by far the most unique feature to Beyond Earth. They allow you to specialize your Civilization with a specific ideology. Players who follow the Harmony path will have players synthesizing with their new planet and the alien life that inhabits it. Supremacy takes a page from the cyberpunk playbook with a focus on augmentation and improvement through technology. Finally there is the path of Purity, which focuses on retaining humanity and destroying anything that threatens that. Not only do these Affinities grant you special units and buildings, but they also change the way that other civilizations react with you. Think of it as being on-par with Religion or Political Doctrines from other Civilization games. The technology tree is also non-linear in this, allowing for you to choose any number of paths which allows for a lot of variety between different civilizations. It did seem like there were a few very specialized paths that were far superior to the others though, as you generally want to amass whatever Affinity you’re going with quickly, as it will immediately upgrade your troops without the need to do things manually like the past Civ games.  This is where the differences in Beyond Earth end though, as everything else is simply re-skinned from Civilization V. Happiness has been replaced with Health, Gold has been replaced with Energy, while food and production remain the same. There are also a lot of things that don’t really make sense, such as having the technology to colonize another planet without having anyway to unveil the map. You’ll uncover the mystery planet much the same way as your primitive warriors will back in 4000BC like past Civ games. The tech-tree also has some inconsistencies such as having to research Physics, Chemistry and Computers despite the game taking place in the year 2600. All of the units function the same way as well, with the majority of units being melee along with a few ranged, naval, and air units. The fact that naval technology is used at all is a bit strange with hovercrafts only being unlocked late-game. One would think the majority of units would be flying in a time like this while the few air units in the game function exactly the same way as jets from previous Civilization games. The world in general feels exactly like past civ games, with no option to move on to other planets and what’s worse is that the game seems to have lost any charm or personality that was apparent in other Civ games. Leaders like Genghis Khan, Gandhi, and Montezuma are all replaced with overly polite, boring politicians. None of the civilizations displays any semblance of personality or is anyway memorable. Having a few alien civilizations would have been a great way to add some personality to the proceedings.  Espionage has also been completely buffed and is now nearly game breaking, as spies are now able to stage coup-d’états and take over other civilization’s capitals without any resistance. Should you take a capital, the AI civilizations barely seem to react and will still not declare war on you. If you were expecting this installment to not have bugs, you would be sadly mistaken as the multiplayer is still barely playable. You’ll constantly be faced with disconnects and crashes where you’ll have to re-host the game. You could of course continue the game and have your friends rejoin you, but that will be at the cost of the AI temporarily taking over their civilization and rerouting all production, scientific research and virtues. Even when playing single player, I faced the odd random crash to my desktop which had me frequently reloading auto-saves. The game also feels a lot more tedious when compared to past Civilization games as you'll have to babysit trade convoys and orbital units every few turns. Ultimately, Civilization: Beyond Earth feels like a mod or scenario for Civilization V. It doesn’t stray away or do anything innovative enough to warrant being a standalone title. While the non-linear tech tree, quests and affinity system are welcomed, they allow for some unbalanced combinations. Beyond Earth is also missing many features from past Civ games such as Corporations, Religion, and Great People. Having more meaningful interactions with aliens would have been welcomed as well but the game feels like it was inspired by Sid Meier watching the movie Starship Troopers.  Beyond Earth isn’t a bad game; it just fails to meet the standard set by past Civilization titles and can feel a lot more tedious in the process. We suspect that like its predecessor, Beyond Earth will improve immensely with the addition of expansions but as of now, any cravings you have for space exploration might be better satiated by taking a trip to the theater to see Interstellar. This review is also available in video format: Pros: + Affinity system welcomed + Has that one more turn syndrome + Great Soundtrack +/- Could improve with DLC Cons: - Multiplayer is buggy and almost unplayable - Lacks originality, feels like re-skinned Civ V - Doesn't have much personality or charm If you enjoyed this review, feel free to follow me as a Steam Curator:

On paper (apt, given its origin), sounds great - party-based CRPG plus kingdom management. What could go wrong? As it turns out, a few things. Combat is not enjoyable at all, and there's a hell of a lot of it. The difficulty spikes have been pointed out in other reviews, and I can only echo them. It is not helped by the way that characters start off overloaded with abilities; when combined with the difficulty and limited party AI, the micromanagement involved causes combat to drag on interminably. Kingdom management is even less enjoyable. It's built around a quite specific meta - fail to make certain choices (including, unforgivably, story choices) and progress in a certain manner, and you'll be beset by problems. As much as I hated making story choices to suit kingdom management, the pile of inaccessible options without those choices was even more infuriating. Even then it's replete with frustrations, and you can't delegate to the AI because it's dreadful in this respect. The sad thing is that I actually enjoyed the writing enough to try to push through. Some of the characters are endearing, and I found some of the side quests engrossing (the main quest not so much). Even then, I couldn't bring myself to finish the game - the final quest seemed to drag on forever, and it got to the point where I couldn't force myself ahead any more.  Sidenote, the magical lantern mechanic is the absolute pits. Apparently there's a sequel coming; even if it improves the combat and kingdom management, I'm not going anywhere near it if the accursed lantern is back.

Necronator: Dead Wrong is an interesting premise let down by being released too early. The RPG card battler genre fused with an autobattler is a fun mix, but there isn’t enough content to justify the game’s price. Everything is quite repetitive and the AI eventually devolves into a spam fest instead of using tactics.   Before a run is started, the player is able to choose from the two currently available  commanders which each focus on a different theme. The first general is an undead knight that focuses on buffing units in her hand until even the weakest unit becomes a formidable opponent. The second commander is an undead puppet master who changes the game up a bit by having cards that are essentially towers. This in turn makes Necronator feel more like a traditional tower defense game. In my experience with both of these characters, the undead knight is quite a bit more powerful than the puppet master. This is because the knight is able to make weak units strong for relatively low mana costs. The puppet master’s puppets are strong, especially due to the fact that they can be summoned anywhere around an allied building, but the towers she summons are much too expensive for the their hitpoint pool and relative damage. Especially the Teddy Bear card that takes eighty mana for a unit that is not much stronger than a soldier skeleton.  The overworld is quite similar to the one found in other RPG card battlers in that there are branching paths that can be planned and have differing purposes. The most common are battles, but stores dot the map as do resting spots that provide health, card upgrades, or card removal. Shops require gold and allow for one card to be removed for a cost. Units are summoned using mana that is accumulated over time. Units are mainly undead or demons in appearance and they have health, attack, armor, and movement speed stats. The main issue that I have with the units is that there are only eight kinds of units and they are all pretty similar except for an ability. These abilities aren’t very unique either as other units can often gain these abilities with an upgrade. There are some unique upgrades that I would love to see more of and did make units unique, though they are pretty rare. The best upgrades were for the healer unit. The player could get an attack speed aura, increase the healing aura it emitted, or a rare upgrade was to spawn three weak, albeit, free units every fifteen seconds.  Enemy units have the same issue that player units have in that there is very little variety. Enemy units usually come in five or six varieties and have additional abilities applied to them based upon how hard the battle is, such as an elite battle. Enemies also don’t seem to cost the AI any mana, unlike the player. This makes it so that the AI’s strategy late game is to simply spam an ungoldy amount of units that are quite difficult to beat. The main way to defeat the AI in the early game is by focusing on cheap units with armor breaker. These will rip through the strong enemy units that it spawns as a challenge. The late game strategy is to get lots of units with Area of Effect attacks. The main issue I had with this is that the units with Area of Effect attacks are quite expensive in terms of mana which makes it difficult to compete against the legions of enemy units that run at the player. An interesting concept this game employs is that both the player as well as the AI gets artifacts. The main issue I found is that there are a good amount of player artifacts that are useless, while the AI has a ton of really strong artifacts. Two of the useless artifacts I received were coupons that made cards at the shop cheaper which wasn’t an issue due to money being really easy to obtain. The second artifact would summon nine powerful units, but only if the player played six of each card type, which was not realistic at all. Some artifacts such as enchanted pillar which provides more mana are almost required for a good run. Enemy artifacts are powerful as they often punish the player’s deck with useless cards.  Battles are fought on a three-dimensional map that has a certain path that units follow. Later maps have additional paths that can be chosen between by the player by modifying the direction a sign is facing. Battle is rather zen, but gets annoying later on in a run. This is because there are small villages that provide extra control and start out under enemy control. Late game, if the player does not get these villages in about a minute and a half, they have lost.  Battle maps don’t have a lot of variety and are simply reskins. This feels lazy and unpolished. There is a minor story, but it isn’t interesting. The player has a summoning crystal fused to them and they have to find the great Necronator. The traveling companion to the player’s chosen commander is a cute bat character named Chubat.  The sound design isn’t especially good in Necronator. The music gets quite repetitive very quickly, so much so that I turned it off withing the first ten minutes I played the game. The sounds can also get cacophonous as many units attacking each other all making attacking sounds playing over each other does not sound enjoyable at high to moderate volume levels. The graphics are the best part of the game. The game is three-dimensional in nature, but the textures are styled after pixel art which creates a diorama feeling. This is further compounded by the fact that all of the units in the game are pixel art sprites.  The controls are quite frustrating to deal which is surprising considering keyboard and mouse is rather accurate. When trying to pan using the left mouse button, sometimes it doesn’t work when the player accidentally mouses over their hand full of cards. The game also feels too much like a mobile port. To move the camera without accessing the camera menu, the player must swipe left or right with the mouse while hold the right mouse button.  :  The game feels pretty buggy, especially with the pathfinding AI. This AI never seems to know where to go and gets stuck rather frequently. After about 5 hours I felt like I had already seen everything. Due to this, the twenty USD price tag is too high to justify the amount the amount of content in it.    👍   👍 Beautiful graphics 👎   👎 Low enemy variety Few units to use Repetitive gameplay

Nice try...but ultimately a swing and a miss. The contradictions and discoveries you make don't lead to the killer....instead, the linear gameplay and story just wrap it up for you. The biggest gameplay flaw is that there are many things the characters say that should count as a "contradiction", but they don't since the story follows such a linear path. Some of the actual contradictions are quite a stretch and aren't nearly as contradictary as other statements that apparently "check out" according to the game developers. The acting is very cheesy and over-the-top....not in a good/funny way either. In a game like this, you should like the protagonist, but instead, I found myself wanting to off Jenks and toss him into the lake. As far as performance goes, you'd think it'd be perfect in that regard, but nope! The menu locked up on me numerous times and I had to exit and return to fix it. That led to Jenks saying "that's all for now, might be back later though" and then turning right around "got a few more questions for you"....very immersion breaking.  As for visuals, the locations are nice, but a phoney "night filter" was applied in post-production to simulate the hours getting later. This filter is very obvious and quite unnatural and ugly looking. Another "tell" that corners were cut in the visuals dept. is that when you go to the jetty you notice two people standing across the lake in the exact same spot for the entire length of the game. Lastly, and the final nail in the coffin that prompted this review, is the fact that when the game is over there is no way to bypass the sloooow credits. I watched a few minutes of them, but when I wanted to go back to the main menu to exit, I couldn't. "I don't have time for this ♥♥♥♥", I said, so I ended the process. Doing so however prevented me from getting the last three achievements (of which I rightfully earned), which must be given after the credits. When I went back into the game, the last save was at 10PM and there's no way in hell I'm sitting through the last part of this train wreck again for three funky achievements. Oh, and to top it off, this game never goes on sale. I thought it'd be worth it based on the glowing reviews, but I regret ever buying and playing this. I feel like I just threw 10 bucks out the window and wasted 8 hours of my life.

Black Mesa is a fan made remake of Half Life using the Half Life 2 engine, that was approved by Valve for sale after they apparently ballsed up their own conversion. Half Life is one of those "classic" games where in retrospect it's not exactly ♥♥♥♥ as such, but much of it's perception comes from being in that time and place to see it when it was new.  Because many of those things that were original back then are commonplace now, and have no wow factor when viewed through modern eyes. As a historical relic it deserves the praise for what it achieved in moving gaming forward, as a game to be played by people without nostalgia for it...*coughs* it's a bit arse.   Hey! It did   a shooter.  But, uh, the platforming is ♥♥♥♥.  And the shooting is, uh, bog-standard, which is I guess a bit of a problem for a shooter. It totally put you into the story and never forced you out of first person to follow a cut-scene, or took control from you during any narrative events.....That would be meaningful if there was much of a story going on. There isn't.   It is a "cinematic" experience, that aims for spectacle and ambience. Things like people being yanked into vents by unseen creatures are meant to be scary, or at least register some kind of response. There should be an atmosphere of dread and adversity, where you know you're playing a game and yet you're immersed in it anyway.  With Black Mesa it's all so basic compared to even a recent indie title, that despite a graphical overhaul it just doesn't work as involving spectacle anymore. An old game like Thief can have crude graphics and still be scary, as it's earned through a mixture of ambience and game-play mechanics.  Here the entire effect hinges on the visuals, and the "freshness" of the sequence, as it's only a brief bit of immersion. The problem being that neither is strong enough to succeed in doing so.    It's all rather quaint by now, and the engine in use was outdated when the project started, so by current standards it looks pretty pish. Having to load every 5 minutes is rather disruptive to what little compelling experience it has left to give. Back in 1998 this was the boss, but this mild lick of paint is not enough to really recommend it in this day and age.  It's distinctly "meh" as a blockbuster event, the shooting is a bit mediocre (as it always has been), and the engine should have been taken out back and shot the moment they got the green-light to sell the game. When it was just a fan made conversion it was "cute" (I suppose) that they were using the Half Life 2 engine to tidy up the mess Valve had made themselves of doing it. By this point it was already a bit creaky, but it was also free and had development tools, so presumably that influenced this even being made in the first place.  Taken as a paid for product that took eight years (or so?) to finally release....the grainy textures...the bumbling animations....the almost constant loading breaking up the flow.....  Yuck!  And as someone who uses a controller: this is a relatively recent game, and yet it still lacks such seemingly simple concepts as having a weapons wheel for anyone who plays that way. Switching between weapons is painfully bad here, though that's my particular bugbear as someone who finds the keyboard and mouse to be just as awkward to aim with, but is far more likely to cramp my hands. At the time of this review it's £15. The first two Metro games are £15 standard price. It's not fair in many ways to put them side by side, but not everyone can splash the cash willy nilly. If you only had £15 this is IMO not the best way to spend it.  Is it objectively bad? no, not in the slightest. I've played some ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ awful shooters, and this isn't one of them. Having said that: Does it hold up to modern standards at a time when some modest indie studios are capable of fairly dramatic encounters? nope, not in the slightest.  These days Black Mesa is the equivalent of being a made-for-tv action movie, versus the big budget mayhem of something that's had hundreds of millions of dollars spent on it. As a remake it's old hat, the emperor wearing slightly less shabby new clothes, but still looking pretty rough.  To carry on the film analogy: a lower budget movie might compensate for a lack of special effects, or creative excellence in its action, by having pithy dialogue or interesting drama to lessen the lack of hi-octane hi-jinks. You'll find none of that here, at least not to a degree where it's either super funny, or intriguing enough to smooth over the general blandness on  offer. It's passable but a bit "meh" in every way.  Is it scary? be real.... Is it pulse poundingly exciting?....uh, noooo.  Does it still have some massively boring bits that were massively ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ boring in the original too? yup.  The individual parts have all been done better elsewhere, and instead of getting a Michael Bay blockbuster remake you've gotten exactly what this began as - a fan made effort. That they're charging for it is not the problem, because I do respect the work that went into it. It just simply doesn't compare to newer games on newer engines, and I honestly can't recommend it. Yes - I'll no doubt get some stick for this opinion, but given the choice between playing a remake of the hallowed Half Life, or something like, ooh, lemme bring out "da big gunz" here, Titanfall 2 maybe, The Metro games, or a fun little gem like Singularity, I would never choose this.  It's clunky in it's technology and game-play, is totally lacking in atmosphere as a result of both, and is not particularly compelling as a narrative. It was the jack of all trades back in the day, but by virtue of being better than anyone else that made it a master at the time.  20 odd years later this is pish compared to the likes of Metro, which is fun in the shooty-shooty-bang-bang, scary in it's scares, and makes better "cinematic" use of the first person POV. Admittedly the story-telling is a load of old arse, but Black Mesa / Half Life aren't all that great in that department either. One last thing to put this in perspective: I actually did play this way back when, on the ps2, and even from a position of nostalgic affection I can see it doesn't cut the mustard in 2020. Игра не стоит 1000 рублей. 200 - край. Во всех аспектах хуже 5-й части, на мой взгляд. Да, времени на прохождение больше, но не за счёт сюжета, а за счёт искусственных "палок в колёса". Играем с корефаном и испытываем постоянные проблемы с сетью: задержки и дисконнекты через час-два совместной игры. В 5-й части такого не было. Управление конченное. Какой дурачок придумал прыжок через препятствия и бег на одну клавишу делать? Из-за этого получается так, что ты поднимаешься по лестнице, например, когда убегаешь от злоебучего вертолёта и антропоморфных жмыхов, но из-за кривизны управления спрыгиваешь к ним вниз и дохнешь. Или убегаешь по прямой, случайно задевая ящик какой-нибудь, после чего перс мигом начинает через него скользить назад... Слишком большая сенса для меня даже на самом минимуме: за движение от края до края ковра - 2,5 оборота на 360. Инвентарь тоже на любителя. На мой взгляд в 5 части попроще с ним было. И то, что у каждого свой лут и эмблемы, а не общие, тоже бесит. Слишком много экшена. Бывают такие сцены, когда тебе обязательно нужно сделать выстрел, а если ты его не сделаешь, то провал операции. Проходим на максимальной сложности. Патронов почти всегда нет (зачем они, когда можно спавнить нам опыт, за который открываешь навыки, которые на максимальной сложности не работают?). Корефан часто бегает с ножом. Результат, думаю, ясен. Графон: персонажи приблизительно на том же уровне, что и в 5 части, текстурки 50/50: часть лучше, а другая часть - полная халтура; принты фонов - ужасного качества. Никаких загадок нет. Только экшн. [3/10]

DooM Eternal is a bit of a disappointment. Between a bit heavy handed gameplay, unreliable always online drm and a big collectathon i don't think this game is worth it's asking price. (Especially not with the dlc.) What i'm missing is the thing that made DooM 2016 good/fun. An arcade mode that skips the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥. The soundtrack is amazing and always fits very well to what is currently happening in game and i hope we will be able to buy it standalone soon. The graphics are very good and good looking albeit a bit generic knight/viking levels were added and the hell aesthetics aren't that gritty anymore. (compared to 2016) Gameplay feels more like a character action game (like dmc e.g.) in first person than a shooter. Movement got upgraded with dashes and a grappling hook on the ssg (yay :D) but this is needed since normal movement is pretty much only useful out of combat to get you to the next fight. In combat you jump, dash and monkey bar swing away from demons in enclosed arenas where you are expected to dispose every enemy according to it's assigned way. If you happen to not utilise the enemies gimmick/weakness they are very bullet spongey which you can't afford them to be because ammo is intentionally scarce and you have to rely on the fodder enemies as your resource (health/armor/ammo) batteries. I have a feeling they mistook action with being stressed and just added more mechanics (aka stuff to worry about) on top until the right level of stress was reached. The progression system is awful and annoying. Almost everything that makes combat a bit more fun is locked behind a progress bar or point system. The first hours of this game is work to get to the fun and strongly reminds me of game design that wants to push you to paying money to avoid the grind. I mean to improve a weapon you have to find a drone to unlock a specialisation first. Then get weapon points to improve it and unlock the mastery and then do a challenge to really unlock the mastery which you can skip by paying another kind of token. You have to do this twice for every weapon and a similar system is in place for the suit and health/armor/ammo upgrades. Did i mention the weapon you have to unlock by collecting keys through completing challenges and the batteries you have to collect to unlock skins or other unlock currency? But when you have worked through the annoying/awful things the game is quite fun. Alas not as fun as the hype bros want to make you believe. Edit: (I forgot to mention the issues with  When you are starting the game or loading a level or just open the codex/arsenal ingame menu with tab the game wants to connect to  . If the service is not reachable or slow you are forced to wait a long time through the connect attempt without the ability to abort.
Pro TIp: Save your $40 and just play Fortnite

Задумка интересная - за это плюс.  Сейчас буду заливать насколько игра классная и проделано много работы, но..... нет. Игра вышла в 2017 году, графика в игре 2010 года - за это минус. Реализация задуманного (сюжет, атмосфера) на уровне "школьник-самоделкин". Что в этой игре делает метка "хоррор"? - тут НЕТ ничего к этому относящегося. Коридорная бродилка, нудная и скучная. Атмосфера настолько убогая, что даже негде сделать скрин, чтобы запечатлеть ту самую атмосферу.  Через 2ч игры заболела голова от всей этой нудной атмосферы (буду судиться с автором за причинение вреда моему здоровью) Не для трезвых умов, проходить только на пьяную голову. тему данной игры можно было бы реализовать на более высоком уровне и получить достойного конкурента в мире хорроров, но автор не смог. Если брать сия чудо, то только за 100р.

The game has a pleasant pixel graphics art style and a very sophisticated combat system. You can unlock many things, even enemies as playable characters in the battle mode (vs mode). The difficulty curve is a bit high as you have to learn parry timings and somewhat precise command inputs for anti airs which are essential for combos. What is missing is save functionality or mission select. When you close the game you have to start from the beginning and cannot continue from where you left off. That in particular is a problem for me because until now i couldn't complete the story mode because the game always crashes on me around the last level and every time it does i don't feel the urge to play the whole thing again. :/ The game is a bit too "oldschool" for me, i miss quality of life stuff almost all games did since the 90s.

Star Wars: The market Research: Jedi Think about Sekiro. Remove every single item except gourd upgrades. Slap in hundrets of useless cosmetic reskins .. not even unique skins.. just colour swaps. Add janky dodge and awful lvl and boss designs. Add Star Wars Setting and basic cosmetic Lightsaber costumization and you have this game. The Story around Cal was okay. I liked him and his Character progression but that's it. Everything screams Disney.. I can't even really describe what I mean here. Well I could.. but that would require me spoiling the whole story and the ending. No worries. I don't. I just didn't like it at all. Except like I said.. Cals character progression. Zero Replay Value. It's short. Understandable for a market research game. EA wanted to look how it sells to build on it. We can expect far more in the future. Still not worth the 35 euro I paid for this. Even when I can admit some love for the details. It's not like respawn did a bad job. It's just not good. Instead of coming up with their own ideas they used Sekiro as template. But did everything except graphics poorly. I don't understand the hype around cosmetics in a singleplayer game you wont ever play again after you beat it. And this game is full of it. No need to explore at all. Since your average box just has hilt number 21 or ship reskin number 11. I hated it. Killed literally the whole metroidvania part of the game since exploring has no merit unless you have troube with the gameplay since stim upgrades are very hidden. I loved BD-1 best video game companion ever. We need more BD-1 in our video games. Tbh. BD-1 carried the game for me. That lil qute robot hooked me through the whole game. I just wanted to know how it ends and never bother again.

FR et GB: Pour un AAA en vente depuis longtemps, il y a toujours les mêmes lags sur Sanctuary et les mêmes blocages pour les caisses de munitions. Quant au dernier DLC, il n'est même pas traduit dans d'autres langues... mais vendu et je ne parle pas de l'aspect Coop... Si 2K n'est pas en mesure de vendre des jeux pleinement opérationnels, il y a des possibilités de reconversion dans la vente de voitures d'occasion ou de chaussures...Songez que vos clients sont profondément déçus par votre manque de professionnalisme. C'est si facile de modifier les capacités d'une arme ou d'un équipement de quelques points pour se vanter de millions d'éléments d'équipements. Vous avez beaucoup à apprendre d'équipes comme ASOBO ou de programmeurs comme Alan EDWARDES qui livrent des produits finis sans être AAA. Supposed to be a AAA game, sold for a long time, gamers are to support the same lags in Sanctuary and the same incidents with the ammo boxes. Considering the last DLC, it isn't even properly translated in foreign langages... but sold and I am not writing about Coop blockages... If 2K isn't able to  sell working games, try to sell used cars or shoes, even whatever. But do think you have custommers deeply disappointed with your lack of professionalism. It's so easy to change the capabilities of equipments or weapons to claim they are billions of tools. My real feeling is that you have a lot to learn with teams as ASOBO or programmers as Alan EDWARDES who deliver finished and playable products without being AAA

Есть такая работа - защищать человека от покушений. Работа опасная и сложная. Игра предоставляет нам шанс ощутить это. Попробуем? При посещении первой миссии, на тебя накатывает огромный оглушительный рёв. Ни музыка, ни мелодия, только это безоговорочное равнодушное оружие по уничтожению слуха. Лучше поберегите уши и выключите это, если всё же запустили игру. А ещё лучше включите избранную мелодию в плейлисте. Как только вопрос со звуком решён, глаза начинают подмечать  . Она легонько бьёт по органам зрения, но не ослепляет ужасающим качеством. Впрочем, слепленные более-менее активные модельки смазываются сильно устаревшими угловатыми модельками массовки. Предметы же вроде столов, стульев, колонн немногим лучше собратьев в открытых ресурсах. Теперь вы нажимаете на клавишу " " для лицезрения походки главного героя. Он двигается нормально... Пока не начинаются ступеньки!  . В течении последующих секунд охранник картинно и неестественно долго падает. Его физика герметичного мешка с водой - причина повышенной сложности выполняемой задачи. В сочетании с точно такими же модельками людей и странными нерегулируемыми прыжками, к концу игру можно возненавидеть. Но это ещё не всё. Сами уровни это то ещё веселье. Они основаны на уже упомянутой физике. Притом, где-то даже перебарщивают - да, подпёртый колоннами мост, который может  развалиться просто по случайности, потому что не задумано даже для начала дать персонажу на него встать? Или как насчёт пробраться быстрее всех по узким платформам, между которыми периодически пролетает импровизированная большая булава? В общем, при умножении таких уровней на героя получается злость. Отдельно, очень субъективно и предвзято хочу сказать о значках достижений. Это что, чёрт возьми, такое? Это кто придумал? Это.. Иконки? По мне так мусор, который отвратно выглядит во всех ипостасях. Боюсь даже подумать, какие получаются значки от карточек... В общем, это треш. Некрасивый, невесёлый, багованный, бессмысленный. Не стоит на него тратить деньги, а тем более время и нервы. Обходите эту игру стороной.

Не люблю писать негативные обзоры к играм и всегда ищу за что похвалить разработчиков, но... Начитавшись обзоров западных блоггеров, я рассчитывал увидеть "шикарную графику на исключительно новом оригинальном движке" и "сюрреалистичный параллельный мир". Однако, 20 минут настроек уже установленной игры не смогли решить нескольких проблем: 1. Игра запускается только в оконном режиме; 2. Игра поддерживает работу только с системой 32бит и DeirectX 9.0; 3. Российский перевод текста в игре периодически сменяется на немецкий, а перевод озвучки зачастую сменяет английский язык прямо по ходу геймплея. Помимо технических проблем, в игре отсутствует минимальная оптимизация, засчет которой графика начала 2010 года на максимально возможных настройках выдает размытое слайдшоу. Геймплей игры заключается в типичном поиске выхода из комнаты, который в свою очередь, продуман на уровне дойти до противоположной стены. , в которой по локациям разбросаны записки с текстом  . В 2015 году (в году релиза игры) уже никто не верит в подобную ересь, не говоря уже о 2016 в котором я пробую играть в это. Заскриптованные фразы ГГ, привязанные к определенному месту на локации, раздражают чуть меньше чем общее музыкальное сопровождение игры, которое пытаются продать отдельно за 200р. Единственным плюсом этой игры является то, что ее вполне можно купить за 20-30 рублей на распродаже, чтобы окупить ее стоимость продажей карточек. И даже в этом случае, не запускайте эту игру. Пресловутая "Gone Home" или меланхоличная "Dear Esther" в разы приятнее для прохождения. Спасибо за внимание, надеюсь что помог Вам   эту игру.

For formatting and pics go to:  What Space Base DF-9 did right  -Great visual Appeal One of the things i love about SBDF-9 is the look and style, they just seem right. And it reminds me of the Sims 4 or Sim City(2013) -Great idea for a game lots of people have done building games, city games,etc, but Space Bases are few. The idea for this game is Perfect, now if only the game was... What Space Base DF-9 did wrong -Did not deliver on the Double Fine Games website they had a roadmap (now long gone) of things they said they were going to try to add. It was a big one. And yes i know that even they said it wasn't "set in stone" but it was used to get people to buy the game, and now only about 20 to 40% of those features are in the game, and it kinda feels like they tricked us.  -Left the Game unfinished Double Fine Games the dev and publisher has left SBDF-9 to make another game and thereby make more money. They basically blame the community citing that "not enough people bought the game to fund it". Perhaps because the game is in an Alpha state at the most  -retarded AI I don't know about you but when i'm in a space base on the far reaches of the milky way, i get pretty damn pissed when i don't have Five Star meals, or Gyms, or bars, or TV. So mad i start trashing my own Oxygen tanks thereby killing myself. What? You wouldn't do that? Well the AI in this game does that. Yep, if they aren't living in luxury they decide life just ain't worth living.  -Not Worth the price If Double Fine Games was going to keep working on this, i would say this is worth the price, however they aren't so really there is no point in spending cash on it. Its not going to get better, its not going to get fixed, and its not a good game.  -bugs and glitches that will never be fixed Not being able to build, Oxygen not being produced despite the fact i have Oxygen tanks and more, these are bugs and glitches that will never be fixed.  -Made us pay for their failure This is more of a issue of Double Fine Games itself. They the whole reason they said the game is being shut down is because one: Not enough people bought it, and two: they ran out of Kickstarter money. If they did run out of kickstarter money then STOP working on another game and spend that money on the game you sold us.  -This is not the first time Double Fine Game has let people down Another game by DFG, Broken Age was also misleading. The game is sold as a full game but it is like TellTale games in that there are "Episodes". Right now, a year after the funding for the game ended there is only ONE  episode, with a "promise" that the second one will be coming on "sometime in early 2015"  Who Space Base DF-9 is for -People who like wasting money  -People who don't care about playing an unfinished game  -People who buy games on sale  -Idiots Final Thoughts The idea behind this game is amazing, and if worked on properly it could be a masterpiece. But it won't and thats a shame. Normally i keep supporting even bad EA games because i figure "eh, they will fix it later" i mean at the point i've already given them money, the best thing to do is hold on to the hope (however pointless) that the game will get better. There is no hope with SBDF-9, not anymore. And yes, modders could make it better, and they could make it a great game, but my belief is that if modders have to fix your game, and i mean Make it playable, then you've already failed.

EDIT: To those of you who think it's unfair that I'm giving the game a thumbs down, I cannot with good conscience recommend something that doesn't play through the tutorial without crashing on an Nvidia 780 Ti card, 16GB of RAM and an Intel i7 core with 3.4GHz. I'm ok with performance drops, not with outright crashing into unplayability. I THINK this is a good game. It feels like it from the tutorial. The tutorial which I've played about eight or nine times now because the game is constantly crashing, there's no autosave functionality and some good distance before you're allowed to save, as I've never reached that point before crashing. Even with the unofficial community patch that's out now, I'm still having a lot of issues. And yes I'm playing on an Nvidia card with an Intel i7 GPU so I'm not having any of those AMD-issues, it's crashing for an assortment of reasons, unfortunately. I'll write a proper review once the game gets fixed. Until then, I can't really recommend something that's as unstable as this. It still works for a lot of people but it seems to be a lottery of hardware and driver-combinations whether or not you're one of those people. Still, I don't regret buying the game, just hoping there's some official fixes coming soon. EDIT (AGAIN): I got a different GPU now (GTX 1080) and the game no longer crashes on me. So far I am having fun, but I still can't get myself to change to a positive recommendation, until the problem with the older card series has been explicitly adressed.

Despite this being a pretty good game I absolutely DO NOT recommend buying it unless you have a LOT of nostalgia for it. This game is about 20% of my childhood, so I can overlook a lot of flaws that others would say are inexcusable. Bugs, stuttering, crashes, freezes and AI that has just graduatd the school of breathing will plague your playthrough. Despite this game being released in bloody 2007 it is highly unoptimized and even on a decent mid-range rig(1070 TI, 32 RAM and an Intel I-5 8gig) it is so damn messy. If you can somehow overlook those flaws(as well as some absolute ♥♥♥♥-tier levels like Ascension and Onslaught) you will find a game that still somewhat holds up. If there ever was a 'somewhat' option for a review on Steam, this game deserves it.

Não vale 130$. Nenhum personagem é interessante, pelo menos não me apeguei a nenhum deles, diferente de Until Dawn que tinha alguns personagens com personalidades cativantes. A narrativa entre eles é rasa, também não demonstram o sentimento de perda envolvendo outro personagem. A história é decepcionante, muito fraca, você já se liga no que está acontecendo na metade da gameplay, e é chato pq nem senti mais vontade de jogar depois disso, pois as escolhas se tornam fáceis e você se torna ciente sobre qual é a escolha certa a fazer.  Sobre o terror, Man of Medan não consegue proporcionar uma experiência de terror convincente, depende muito de jump scare, além dos sustos serem previsíveis. Enfim, o jogo não é extremamente ruim, rola uma gameplay bacaninha, porém não vale o preço(50% off até dá p encarar).

( 누가 이런겜 하냐지만 본인이 하게 됬다는게 학계의 정설 ) 게임은 그럭저럭 옛날 레트로 감성 가득가득한 우주선을 조종해 적을 죽이면 되는 심플한 게임인데, 이게 또 의외로 적이 터져 죽을때가 은근 퀄리티가 높더군요. 물론 본인 플레이 타임은 93분입니다. 귀하께서는 여러분에게 특별 제작된 우주 비행선을 타고 적을 죽이러 가는 신참 병사라 칩시다. 여러분은 그저 마우스 이런거 다 필요 없고 키보드만 쓰시면 됩니다. 다양한 퍽, 다양한 우주선, 개발진을 조금은 갈아넣은 듯한 이펙트까지. 요즘같은 고퀄리티 픽셀 게임에 비교하자면 당연히 그리 특출난 게임은 아니지만 짤막하게 즐기기엔 좋다는거죠. 단점은. 컨텐츠가 없어 그냥 검고 공허한 맵, 어느샌가 같은 적만 조우하는 당신을 보게 될겁니다 더군다나 도전 과제도 그리 쉽게 주는것도 아니에요, 은근 빡세게 해야 보상을 준달까요. 또한 타 픽셀 게임에 비례해 픽셀이 은근 많이나와 익숙치 않은 분들이 즐기기엔 어려울수도 있다는점이 있겠네요. 혹시나 저 같이 이 게임 하게되실 분이 있다면 차라리 다른 1100원짜리 게임을 찾으세요. 물론 그 다른 1100원 짜리 게임이 재미있을거란 보장은 못하겠네요. :P
